EINxzqiWJ8o3-K_8Lxnavg.text: It was our first time visiting Barcelona.  They open at 4 o'clock and we arrived at 410 PM on a Saturday. The place was packed already.  We shared a variety of small plates and vegetable paella.  Overall the food was good and our server was very friendly.  We just went to a tapas place in Las Vegas a couple of days ago and this place was not quite there, but close enough.  Olive oil cake needs whipped cream to counter the dry cake in my opinion.  Overall a solid 4 star.

8cRN9wf8H58ygITtRYvFMA.text: This is already my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte - and I'm not the only one saying this! The location is perfect being right next to Superica, Jeni's, and being right off the East/West light rail stop. The GM was great with us as well as our servers. Very professional and knew their dishes and wines well. The ambiance is amazing. The red sangria was excellent and we tried three other red wines that we all loved. We had paella, lamb, a potato tart, just to name a few. We tried a few cheeses (Drunken Goat was everyone's favorite). We also got to try the chocolate cake, olive oil cake, and flan. I was close to tears of joy as every dish came out. Barcelona, I love you and will be back often.

sA9LTE08U2qH8_rLtEiIqw.text: Having spent some time enjoying tapas in Spain and in the US, we were excited to dive in to Barcelona Wine Bar's food and wine selection.  Like most folks I look at atmosphere/up-fit, service/staff, wait time, and dining experience/food quality and presentation.  The atmosphere did not disappoint and the restaurant, with 200+ seats, was packed and buzzing.    Mostly professional Millennial's eating there, and mostly tatoo'd and trendy young staff.    Wait time was 20 minutes beyond our reservation time.  Staff were "OK", and somewhat cross trained, although our female server kept barging in when we were talking rather than waiting a second...and needed to be reminded several times as we initially sat without drinks and then later with empty wine glasses for 10 minutes after our first glass of wine.    We ordered calamari and prawns a-la-plancha as well as Paella Marisos (for 2)  as our entree. The calamari was lightly battered, not too heavy, but on the chewy side (I like it crispy) - not sure if it was fresh or had been frozen - and it came with a very nice remoulade sauce. Prawns were good sized but also chewy.  The Paella came out and it was so burned that it was really not palatable.  The waitress said "this is the way Paella is cooked".  While some may serve Paella with a very slight char on the sides of the pan, I can you that this is NOT how Paella is made or served.  We ate around all of the burned portions about a 1/4 of the Paella (around the severely burned portions), and left the rest.  I was in disbelief that a Chef would ever send an entree like this to a table - but I guess he was slammed and more focused on volume than quality. In my estimation, especially when dealing with  first time customers, it is better to send the customer a comp tapas or a glass of comped wine and the customer have a slightly longer wait than to send out a bad entree.  Very bad first impression and it will stick with us.    Wine at Barcelona Wine Bar is served 100% by the glass pricing with no bottle price discount, unusual and focused on profit maximization rather than market convention.    Bathrooms are unisex with "WC"  for Water Closet on doors (a British nomenclature in a Spanish restaurant - should I have ordered a Black and Tan to drink?).    The Spanish wine selection of the wine list is "ok" but not what you would expect for a Tapas joint.    Overall, I would not go back in the near future for dinner...perhaps if it were strictly for a glass of wine and a quick tapas after work.    The Paella needs a lot of work and the chef needs to pay more attention to entree's and not just tapas (small plates).  Maybe in 6 months to a year the chef will find his groove...we may check it out again after enjoying some more established chef's offerings at other Charlotte restaurants.

8VaVr6MwOrD-weUPAKZrKg.text: Great tapas and good sangria. Wait staff was nice and attentive. Cool vibe. Called ahead for reservations so recommended... not a huge fan of their bathrooms - unisex so can get messy.

bWhEswuY2CITPJpA1F7Dhg.text: What a great place! The bartenders and staff are so welcoming. Our wait time was about 1.5 hours and the GM managed to seat us earlier. He came by several times to make sure we were happy (just look for a guy that looks like Paul Rudd!!) The food was amazing and our server gave some spot on suggestions. We had such a great time and plan to come back soon. Worth the wait!!!

LXw-VmYwPxm1Kq3UZmgMCg.text: Excellent atmosphere for date night or a night out with girlfriends.  I went with friends most recently, and each of us ordered 3-4 tapas to split.  I highly recommend the scallops, mushrooms, and croquettes.  So good!  It was a bit crowded for a Tuesday night but service was still excellent.  We arrived around 6 so we just missed the dinner rush.  Will definitely be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Empanadas, scallops, croquettes, salad, and mushrooms

VijvNnK7AFrjldagd2RFZA.text: My absolute favorite. Food, service and wine are all incredible! The two hour waits are the worst part - but tell you how good this place is!

vMp_8KxIEywThDYRhz1Npg.text: I enjoyed the atmosphere but the food was nothing special. Additionally the restrooms were unisex, not clean and always a wait for a restroom. No valet parking.

fU-6lJwP3ti8dFCDgKVZCg.text: Fun ambiance and amazing food/wine. The cheese and meat boards make me want to plan a trip back to Spain!

n2hnRBO-nIX0Ahhjz-p6lQ.text: Everything we tried was okay. We had the mussels, calamari, meatballs, beef empanadas, and croquettes. Nothing stood out and we probably won't return.

jaIo1HuINwscHzdnBiwFMA.text: Had a great experience here last weekend. Showed up right at 4pm with 10 people. They won't seat you without everyone in your party which was fine but they still set us up a table. Drinks were great, I got the red sangria, and food was really good too. Great atmosphere!

LIaEoGJ_LXbiQw6NnhuyJQ.text: Excellent atmosphere and service with tasty food! Some of the tapas dishes are on the pricey side but the taste is worth it.

RUKt1xd04vhNUtLFbmf1PQ.text: Absolutely amazing!  I have been going to the Barcelona in DC area for a while but this new one in Charlotte is so much better. The service is incredible, the place is really cool and everything we ordered was delicious.

iRMBkeuJqKVcst7IBOggCA.text: I've been to the one in Stamford, CT and can say the one here in Charlotte is just as great. Food is amazing and I recommend a pitcher of red sangria

viZZ10WpOcuWzsb_ohkt4g.text: Lots of restaurants have great food, but what makes a restaurant deserve 5 stars are the employees that work there. Dustin was our server and he made our night! I'm in Charlotte visiting friends (I live in California) and now i need to come back again soon!! Thank you so much Dustin for a wonderfully memorable evening.

mX8gk1YAjevB202HDc2SZw.text: I have been to this place several times and I literally love the vibe. Friendly staff and wonderful drinks

UMuxvHSm6trDAIigLYXmoQ.text: Awesome place for this city. Amazing tapas. Wines are not as great as you would expect but the food alone is worth the trip

g54-sl3Ex6tgxsaAvpBLYg.text: This place was hopping when we arrived. Still from the greeter, to the multiple servers and everyone in between all had a quick smile. The food was amazing. We sampled about a third of the menu and can't wait to go back to try the rest. The spinach & chickpea dish was seriously one of the best things I have every had. Empanadas were like a grown of version of sloppy joes and every way the octopus was cooked was . Drink menu was extensive and I love the ability for smaller pours on the wines allowing a lot more sampling. We will definitely be back.

4nvKV8Tk42sCOCkQQ2WthA.text: I absolutely love this place. We went here as a party of three to celebrate a birthday and as soon as we walked in we were greeted by cheerful hosts who got us on the list. We were expecting a wait so didn't mind being quoted 45 minutes for the patio because it was a really nice evening and a holiday weekend. The host let us know we were welcome to get a drink at the bar and there was some standing room if we wanted to wait outside. As soon as we found a small gap in people at the bar a bartender was waiting to take out order so that was really nice to not have to flag someone down. After being seated we ordered a red sangria pitcher -amazing. A charcuterie board, oysters, artichoke, and potato tortilla -all delicious. We also ended up getting the pork belly and meatballs which were so good we ordered extra bread so we could savor the sauce both came in. Because it was my friends birthday they brought complimentary olive oil cake and crepes and they were so amazing. I seriously can't wait to come back here. Loved the people who worked here, the rustic atmosphere and decor and delicious food and wine.

XFALJGAx-2soYIT6hmcUXg.text: I really loved the small plates.  They were amazing with handling food allergies, and the service overall is good, especially for a place open quite late.   The cocktails are ok... but it is advertised as a wine bar.  The main selling point are lots of really delicious and fresh seafood and fish tapas.

0yLgAkVZXd_fnkMaElcGlw.text: Where do I begin.... I waited MONTHSTO BE ABLE TO EAT HERE. Every time I came in I they had an hour wait. So when I FINALLY GOT TO EAT here my expectations were high..... the menu is not very extensive, the wait was long, and the paella had a weird taste.... I wasn't satisfied.... it was a nice place but I guess you guys can judge on your own.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Way too pricey

EXAXQOreiiQW2gpYxiF19Q.text: This is not a real Spanish tapas restaurant. Some of the dishes are tasty, but that's only because they all have tons of salt! Dishes are supposed to come out slowly giving you time to enjoy each tapa without them getting cold. At this place, everything felt rushed and pushy.  We sat at the 4 top inside near the exit door by the back patio. We sat down at 5:15 on a Thurs. All the waitors who weren't busy, would huddle around our table and watch us eat. I felt like I was being babysat for the amount of times people came over to the table asking to order more. I felt rushed. After the restaurant started getting busier, the noise increased tremendously, I couldn't hear the convo at my table. The place was packed and it was crazy how loud the music was being played.   I think this place is extremely overrated. It was so crowded by the bar area, it was stressful finding the restrooms. This whole experience made me not want to come back anytime soon.

YG-9Uuij2YkOLIF06yqF0Q.text: I came here with my family on a Saturday night - packed at 5:30pm! Let's start with the positives. We waited for table for a half hour and ordered drinks at the bar. The bartenders and wait staff are fantastic, very nice and knowledgeable!   Having just returned from 3 months abroad in Argentina and Spain,  I was impressed with the wine list. A ton of options from these 2 countries!   Now, on to the food - the disappointing part. In True European fashion, they brought delicious bread and olive oil to start. For the tapas: Patatas bravas: the only redeeming dish we had Jamon serrano: terrible! This is what Spain is known for and they did it wrong. Pimientos: undercooked! This is one of my favorite Spanish dishes but these were not done well. Albondigas: flavorless. Skip! Oysters: horrible! Was there even an oyster hiding in there under all of the bread crumbs?! Pork belly: overcooked & also flavorless (they tried to make it better but failed with too much salt) Croquetas: meh. I can make these better myself.  For $160 without tip and this restaurant being the new "rave" in town, I expected better. To top it all off, we all had stomach issues during the night. Overall, I'd recommend this place for the wine, bread, and atmosphere...not the food!

NSBJqYwBDFMK6nPMRJ5t_A.text: The ambiance is on POINT and the food was yummy. We sat at the bar. The bartender took our order. The tapas comes out fairly quick and he gave us heads up that the entrees could  take up to 30 minutes. My friend's entree took 45 minutes plus. She canceled her order by that time she didn't want to eat at 8:45pm. The manager came to apologized and explained that they were missing the main ingredient and had to make a trip to the store. You would think that they would be more prepared as the night went on. I'm sure the dish wasn't the first to be ordered at 8pm. Regardless, the manager packed the dinner to go for my friend and gave the three of us Tapas tokens for the next dining outing.   The manager was the saving grace of how he handled the situation.

KC-E-djvG1KsPDKygYqsVA.text: The Queen City has finally brought in a restaurant that we don't deserve! Barcelona wine bar is hands down the best restaurant in the Queen City currently. It checks off all the boxes, offering great food, drink selection, atmosphere and service! I came here over the weekend to celebrate my birthday with a party of 8 and everyone could not stop talking about how great the food was! I ordered two tapas off of the menu (pictures below) and was pleased with the portion sizes. You MUST, I mean MUST order the potatoes!! They tasted exactly what I had in Barcelona and brought back wonderful memories. One thing to note is this place is no longer a well kept secret which means it is always busy! I recommend coming early or placing a reservation online to avoid the long wait to be seated. But to be clear the wait is totally worth it! I'll be coming back this weekend to try more items off of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

3nxgzhhrZzzAxeXNh4Re6g.text: In a phrase, Barcelona is a must.   Let's start with some basics. Barcelona Charlotte is one of a handful of Barcelona locations in the US. I've been to the DC location, which I think is the first, and while they are different in many ways the core components that make them successful are all here.   Barcelona is at it's heart a tapas restaurant and bar all set up in a way that allows for the guests to socialize both indoors and outside.   The menus vary by location since each local Chef can change up to 60% of the menu. The bar is full service even though it is called a Wine bar. They have plenty of specialty drinks you will want to try.   Now about the food, it is outstanding. Make sure you try a little bit of everything including things you may not normally eat. It's a place where being adventurous will pay off.

jLqOV_opJ680V21_qpK7nQ.text: The Paella was out of this world!! We waited an unusually long time to receive our food so they threw in some free appetizers. Very good customer service

aUpNzhhFNOUON1vXQM4t7w.text: The wine selection is amazing. Tapas style food that was to die for. Whatever your diet may consist of, there's something for everyone here. Service was also excellent. Cheers!

sQfZFlvyGmjC0bmers39Pg.text: My husband and I went to Barcelona on a date night. We traveled to Barcelona, Spain last year for our anniversary and wanted an evening of culinary nostalgia. The food was really good. The patatas bravas were delicious and comparable to those we had in Spain. We also had the almond brittle green beans, clams and meatballs. All of which were very tasty. I will be returning.

ApMAN6zmwWsuMvmhW_reXg.text: Barcelona deserves 5 stars especially due to the excellent service we received yesterday! We purposely went early for dinner and drinks because we knew it gets crowded starting about 6pm. The restaurant has an old rustic feel and has a great back patio. We asked our server for recommendations on drinks and tapas and her picks were great! We had a charcuterie board, meatballs, shrimp, and empanadas. The wines are available in 3 oz or 6 oz pours. We weren't sure about the wine flights, so she picked three 3 oz pours for a "make your own flight" based on our preference.  I'm glad there's another great wine bar in Charlotte!

aEd6nFBOTJBbeTxo62ho2A.text: Excellent service. Sat at the bar for lunch. They let you try a few wines if you need help deciding. The patatas bravas aren't actually spicy, but still delicious! Also ordered broccolini, hanger steak, & croquettes, which were all worth reordering. The tapas are small enough to where you might need 3-4 if you're hungry. Will absolutely be coming back for dinner.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Broccolini, patatas bravas, fresh bread, &amp; a glass of Riesling.

ePrea2EK4UZYYQc5jxGVgQ.text: I have so many good things to say about this place that I can barely wait to write it all.  At first, I was reluctant to come here because I read a bad review about it on Facebook but shortly after I decided I want to try it out on my own.  Our server Dawn was outstanding. I can't say enough good things about her. She spent quality time with my guest and I. She explained the menu, offered many great tapas and helped me chose things I was scared to try. My drink was always full and she was very informative. She made the experience.  Second, the food was DIVINE! I mean everything I ate was delicious. Calamari, crisp, with a good aioli. Patatas were seasoned to perfection, and crisp. The bread was warm and accompanied by olive oil. The olives were.. well you can't mess up olives. The shrimp was GREAT! Spicy and warm. Charcuterie board was great. Brussels sprouts were crisp and seasoned well and lastly... the desserts.  The Olive oil cake sounds weird but is like a cornbread that melts in your mouth. The flan is AMAZING. Overall, I would recommend this place a hundred times and please do yourself a favor and ask for Dawn.  Another plus: the manager came and introduced himself to us and made sure everything was good. I love when placers take the time to do this. A+ for Barcelona!

MUrZhVffodKKAyw4Pkl1qg.text: After hearing how popular this place was, I was waiting until things quieted down, but now I see what all the hype was about! This place is beautifully designed with reclaimed wood, hanging plants, and pretty lighting fixtures. When you walk in, there's a beautiful buffet table that serves as the hostess stand. A group of 5 of us came on a Monday night and only waited a few minutes before being seated at a hightop booth. Our server came around right away to bring waters and ask what we would like to drink. Being indecisive with SO many wine options, she sent over the sommelier (fancy!). We ultimately decided against a bottle so that we could try glasses of multiple things, but the wine list was inclusive of bottles everywhere from $30-$200 per bottle. Glasses were $7-14ish. I ordered two glasses during my meal, both different tempranillo wines and both recommendations from the waitress actually and I very much enjoyed both!  For food, our group ordered the charcuterie to start with the Jamon Serrano (super yummy thinly sliced ham), Cana de Cabra (very soft goat cheese, like brie), and the manchego (my fav spanish cheese! nutty). We then had the Patatas Bravas (roasted potatoes with tangy sauce), roasted brussels (perfectly crisped), and then shared the Jamon & Manchego Croquetas which are basically fried balls of ham and cheese. Everything was excellent! We then got an amazing dessert that was basically a crepe with a very light fluffy cream and hazelnut chocolate drizzle. It was a helluva meal!  Shout out to our waitress, Erin, who was training and still did great!!!!

ljovyS89H4EN7ZvuYuyvIA.text: Made a reservation for my anniversary at this place for 745pm arrived and showed hostess text message of confirmation. Was told this was for the Boston location?? False. We called and booked at the correct location. Hostess put us on for a 2 hour wait. Unbelievable. Never will even attempt to try this place again.

4jvR-x8399EN-SZlABI7_A.text: I save my 5 stars for really exceptional places. I've tried to get into this place for a few weeks but since they don't take reservations, the wait can be 3+ hours at times. I highly recommend going between 4-6 on a weekday so that you don't have to wait or just take the afternoon off from work and plan an afternoon around it :) Sit back and enjoy some tapas and wine and really saver the moment. Our wait staff was exceptional, even though it was a rotation since they are still training. If they didn't know something they asked instead of acting like they did. My friend and I ordered some meat and cheese to start and some olives. If you enjoy olives, I highly recommend that you get a side because they are well worth it. It also came with bread and delicious olive oil. That in itself was plenty of food. Thankfully we didn't order all of the tapas that we had originally thought we could eat because we were beyond stuffed. We did end up trying the croquettes which were very tasty. They also provided us with some "love" which happened to be an order of grilled hanger steak with truffle oil vinaigrette. We felt the love! I can't wait to come back and enjoy all the things that my eyes thought that I could fit in my stomach!!

kfcu71EY2LD1rWio6aacLQ.text: One of the best small plate places in Charlotte and super affordable to share.  Go early or on a week day to avoid a two hour wait.

AJW0_zvztvyn3ZOg28NlpQ.text: It's a cool hip vibe that I'd recommend visiting. The wine selection is good and the food was as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. The bar and patrons

DjpNs8NXmz27zMLcEKWnHw.text: I feel really mixed about this place. My husband took us here for a really wonderful date night and we were both super exited. We got there (make sure you leave a lot of time to find parking) and we're seated. The first thing either of us remarked was, "wow this place is loud." Even at 7pm on a Tuesday night the music and overall atmosphere were so loud that I couldn't even hear our server as she was talking to us. The charcuterie boards are amazing. I'd recommend the chorizo and Romero cheese. Our tapas were the hanger steak (really incredible), grilled yellow squash, and pulpo (octopus). We really loved the food-- it was all incredible. Really, the only thing that makes me not want to return is just the noise level. It is impossible to hear even the person sitting right across from you at the table. If noise doesn't bother you in that way, though, you'll have a 5-star experience for sure.

GdpijFehrntEtEcnr8QEXA.text: Impressed by this restaurant. It has an upscale vibe and was full of beautiful young people when we arrived in a Sunday night.  The benches are comfortable and open. The menu is full of seafood and Mediterranean dishes. We ordered the mussels and little fish that looked like sardines. Everything was fresh and delicious.   When we ordered the meat dish from the "to share" section, there was a bit of miscommunication and we were charged for multiple orders. After talking with the waiter they gave us the entire dish for free. That kind of service guarantees I'll be back again.

ME27cwW92PPyBNAU99dpfQ.text: Yes. So much yes. Everything we had tasted like the Spanish flavors I've been aching for since actually being in Spain. The staff is attentive and friendly; the food is actually flavorful and not toned down to meet the expectations of a spice deprived general public. We are cancelling our reservation tomorrow night so we can eat here again. Barcelona absolutely blew us away. We are determined to go back until we have tried every menu option.

a4N_DSqjVN6u8jucGcr6lQ.text: Barcelona Wine Bar is my new favorite restaurant in Charlotte. My boyfriend and I went here to celebrate our anniversary and I have literally nothing bad to say. We had the Pulpo, Empanadas, Scallops, Steak, Mussels, Shishito peppers, Patatas Bravas, Flan, and the Olive Oil cake plus some of the white sangria. We tried a lot of dishes but still didn't really make a dent in their menu-you have a ton of options! Everything, and I mean everything, was delicious. I will say the mussels were a *major* standout along with the olive oil cake and the patatas bravas. The service was friendly and attentive. The atmosphere is dim and cozy. Some may find the restaurant to be a bit loud, but we were still able to carry on a conversation comfortably and the environment felt lively and fun. Can't wait to come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussels (that broth is to die for) with shishito peppers and steak in the background.

0nvtUt4YGxmAAmxMuECUdQ.text: If you're really into wine, I'd say yes, go and wash all your problems away with wine . For those of you not really in to wine and not really trying to learn, I'd say stay home.   The place is a great Wine Bar, I wasn't too impressed by the food and desert though. At wine bars you're going to have a large selection of wines, and in Barcelona's case...Spanish wines. At the time we visited it was so loud with music and crowds of people, our waitress didn't explain much about the wine list, either because she actually didn't know much about the list or it was too loud.   I think it's neat you can get two different pour amounts ( great for tasting). I also find the ambiance great , great decor, great hangout, great set-up for romantic date if you're into that,  or are  trying to impress someone. It's the bougie spot for when you're feeling bougie. No judgement, just saying :-)

-giOmCuZH5162Yuts7tVRw.text: So I wanted to try a new and different spot. Well, I found it! Service was impeccable, food was AMAZING, ambiance was fantastic. Music plays a bit loud, but bearable. And the red sangria was so good! And.... the servers were so patient when explaining the menu. Everything was great! I was with 2 of my friends. We enjoyed it thoroughly and we will be back.

RY_3hl10iMin4z1rS0an0A.text: Had the opportunity to enjoy this restaurant yesterday, the ambience was superb, the service and food don't fall short of simply amazing. Our waiter Dustin was incredible and took care of my with and I as we were the only people there despite a full house on a Wednesday night. If your a foodie person Barcelona is a must, we had the Pulpo, Gambas , Seared scallops, and their muscles tapa. All extremely taste, and despite the well portioned tapas we also tried their seafood Paella.  Yes we pigged out and so will you with their tasty and amazing flavors.

iuvPmts8-DXFsipa83bP9A.text: I really loved the place. Elaine was our server and she was awesome! The food was great and the wine was great. But this has got to be the LOUDEST place I've ever been. And this is coming from a 50 year old that doesn't hear well. Other than that, I loved it!

i86dRGjeKkB54DyoA7aFNg.text: Don't let the loud environment take away the rich and well combined flavors of the semi-traditional spanish kitchen, as interpreted by this mini chain of hip places where everyone that is somebody wants to spend some time while it's hot.  Yes, the staples are there, with cured meats and great cheeses. Croquetas, dates and seafood well combined in small (quite small!!) plates that leave you wanting more.  The biggest surprise was the bill. Very affordable for these types of places, especially considering how GOOD the service was by everyone, and how DELICIOUS the food was.  10/10 in my opinion, but don't tell them or they'll lower quality soon. Isn't that what happens to all great starting restaurants?- maybe this being a chain will be diff.

t0tXC6OwgnmPC0xnsGIy-w.text: Came the Friday of opening weekend, the place was awesome. The management team brought in experienced bartenders/servers from their other locations to help train, it was fun to listen/learn as they explained things to customers and staff. Everyone was in a great mood and it showed!   The food was fantastic, I wish I could of tried all the tapas dishes, but I will be back in my attempt too :) I feel bad saying this but I wish it wasn't so popular so I could have it all to myself!

TtB0xhMuhvTi-XGZzhKRSA.text: Me and my dude went for the first time on a Friday night, and we'll definitely be back to try more items.  There was about a 20 min wait when we arrived around 6 pm. Not bad at all for a Friday evening. We walked around the neighborhood while we waited. There are lots of shops and other restaurants to walk by while you wait for them to text.  We both like the atmosphere and attention to details with the decor. It's got nice vibes.  Our servers were attentive and really helpful. The only thing I'll say that didn't go perfectly was that we waited a while for my glass of wine while my partner's beer came out first even though I ordered the wine a few minutes before he ordered his beer. Then when his beer came they got mixed up and gave us two beers. We said we ordered one but then they offered us the second as they would just pour it out anyway. When we got the check, we were charged for the second beer even though we didn't order it. That seemed a little unfair to me, but hey we did drink it so... there ya go.  The food was all great. They went above and beyond for me specifically.  I saw here on yelp that it said they had vegan options. When I got there I was hoping the menu would be marked in some way but it wasn't. So I asked our server what vegan options they had and a little while later one of the owners came out with a menu he marked personally with what options were vegan (I'll post a picture for those who want to know). I thought that was really accommodating. If I had a suggestion for them, I would say to go ahead and add a symbol for those dishes on the next menus they print.  My partner ordered:  *Gambas - 7/10 (he said he would like if the shrimp were bigger, but the sauce was really good)  *Beef empanadas - 6/10 (nothing special, but not bad)  *Potato tortilla - 8/10 (didn't expect it to look the way it did... this was really good, just get it)  We shared:  *Squash hummus - 8/10 (if you like hummus, you'll like this; super smooth and a unique flavor)  *Vegetable paella - 7/10 (I thought it was a tad too salty but still really good and worth the wait)  *Broccolini - 8/10 (the sauce they put on it is *great*)  *Spinach-chickpea cazuela - 6/10 (not bad, not outstanding)  ***a 10/10 would be like one of the best things we have ever eaten... for reference.  Overall, for a first experience it was good! I don't mind waiting for things, I understand how it is. And to be fair to the servers, they never left us in the dark. They said a few times, "We didn't forget about it!" which makes all the difference to me.  I'm excited to go back and try more tapas and a cocktail! Thanks specifically to Patrick (and wow I'm so sorry if that's not your name, I think it was...?) for marking that menu for me! Very kind.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Vegan options highlighted!

Q_nMXMzVkPWYBPZt7e8kuA.text: Sat at the bar and was greeted by a very nice bartender named Friday (like the day of the week). Their wine list has such a good mix and it was hard to narrow down the wines I might want. I was interested in either a Pino Noir or Malbec...he suggested a few wine and let me try them! Great start of service!  1st course- We ordered some meats & cheeses from their list along with the truffle bikini which was like a fabulously crafted adult grilled cheese w/ham! HIGHLY RECOMMEND that tapa.  Next up was the grilled broccolini and spiced beef empanadas. Both had nice spice to them and were tasty & great portion sizes.  Last was our main entree.. the chicken pimientos! Now this was recommended by Friday and he said it was the best thing on the menu... Now when service industry people say that it's still either hit or miss but I WOULD HAVE TO AGREE with his suggestion! The chicken was absolutely fire! The inside was moist and super flavorful, the outside was crispy and the sauce was phenomenal. Our mind blown we're blown.   We will 100% be coming back! And hope to link up with Friday again! CHARLOTTES new must try!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

Lbn1V5MHa2Lk6ywAV0MFKA.text: I meant to add to my review how awesome our bartender Margaret was. She had such a sweet, spunky personality. She also was able to create different drinks for me as I prefer my drinks to be on the sweet side. No matter how busy the bar got she checked on us. She is the True definition of a rock star bartender and the reason we'll be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

-EDETrpDyLWhi81WzYANag.text: I sat at the bar and ate alone. The staff was very welcoming and gave me great recommendations. I really like the vibe of the restaurant and the food was superb! I had the mussels and scallops to eat with red sangria. I will be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red Sangria

4_K7RHLOQbjJsz_Vanj3hg.text: There are few times I can say a place has completely knocked it out of the park. This place did in every aspect: service, food quality, taste and drinks.  Barcelona is great for all types of groups: couples looking for a night out, groups or even solo individuals. The staff is so warm and takes the time to ensure you feel welcome.  The first time we came, we sat at the bar. They have a nice selection of cocktails and huge wine list (it's basically a book). The bartender made a few recommendations based on what I usually drink and provided samples. This was great for someone who doesn't know a ton about wine, especially not enough to navigate a huge wine list.  The second time we went all out with the tapas. They start you off with complimentary bread and oil and we chose six tapas for the two of us. Honestly this was too much; we probably could have gotten away with 4 but wanted to try everything.  The portions are very generous small plates. I've been to some places where the small plate arrived and it is shockingly small. This is NOT the case for Barcelona. I highly recommend the Albondigas (juicy meatballs with red sauce), Brussels sprouts and Gambas al Ajillo (shrimp almost like scampi style) but honestly I don't think you could go wrong with anything on the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

kgBDVsiFxTcX4kr79C_BnQ.text: I absolutely loved this place. The decor is chic and the food is amazing. The service was superb! They serve fresh, hot bread that is so delicious. Can't wait to go back and try more of their dishes.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bathroom
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Garlic Shrimp
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Belly

Kxc3AsyHqMsim90NCd3FTw.text: Awesome place with a really good atmosphere, the food is all delicious, you really can't go wrong no matter what you order. I would suggest it is definitely worth over ordering and regretting a full stomach versus under ordering and not getting the full experience. The only downside is that it is a little bit more expensive, but to be honest you should already expect that going in to the place.

W6hhJJiDumt6feYLKnv4wA.text: If you like being jerked around then this is the place for you. Was told 30-40 minutes and it took over an hour. Over priced food. Too many people. Booooo

quxIPQOWtOjXrwwwu45RiA.text: Absolutely one of my favorite meals I've had in Charlotte.  We messed up our reservation and booked Barcelona in a different state so we had to wait for about an hour to be seated. Just when I thought I'd give up and head out, the hostess cane around with a tray of yummy apps for everyone who was still waiting to be seated.  Finally the manager came and got us and after apologizing for the long wait, which was obviously on us, he told our waitress the first drink was on him. We did not hear him say that but found out when we questioned the bill which did not include the drinks we ordered at the table.   Anyway, we ordered the mussels, broccolini, a wonderful piece of fish, and white bean dish and finally a stuffed pepper.  I can't tell you which was my favorite because they were all amazing.  To top it off the bread was crazy delicious.    The vibe is great and definitely on the younger side but that suits these two baby boomers just fine.    Looking forward to bringing friends the next time we go but will be sure to book Barcelona in South End!

SwvE-6VLKS21QO6RW-C5mw.text: My boyfriend and I came here for a much needed date night. When we arrived around 7:30 on a Thursday night they were on about an hour wait. The host told us we could go to the bar and grab a drink while we waited but unfortunately the bar was overcrowded and no option for a drink.  We headed over to the Mexican spot right beside it while we waited for a drink until the host texted us that our table was ready 45 mins later.   Once we got seated our experience went off without a hitch. Our server was fast and friendly, super helpful in explaining the menu since it was our first time.   We both started with wine! So much to chose from! I got a glass of Riesling and my boyfriend got the spicy wine flight. We both enjoyed the wine. We then ordered a bunch of items to share. Albondigas, squash hummus, spiced beef empanadas and grilled hanger steak. I loved the albongias, empanadas and hummus. While my boyfriend was obsessed with the hanger steak.   The atmosphere was very inviting, a little dark but in a good way, comfortable and relaxing. Their bathrooms and waiting area for bathrooms was super rustic and chic.   Afterwards, we decided it will now be one of our top date night places! Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Squash hummus
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Albondigas
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wine Flight

3p9WnymfERD7ZFsG2hXNbw.text: I had been wanting to try the food for some time. It was a great location to catch up with the girls. We had a 6pm reservation and the place was beyond busy by the time we left (so I definitely recommend a reservation on a Friday evening). The service was amazing! I will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Flight
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

4bBLN8gxlXDcpFUZK7K9hA.text: Such a nice restaurant... and such bad service . I waited 30 minutes to get a glass of wine... that should have been the sign. This is a wine bar and my waitress could not recommend a glass of wine to me. So many red flags yet we stayed for tapas ... left after two because the service was just so slow. So disappointed because the ambiance and location are so nice.

c77LD3jL8d_14Yhs5etuGw.text: Visited Barcelona on a Sunday night with some girlfriends. The vibe was good, although the music was really loud, so it was hard to hear each other at times. The decor is trendy and warm. They had a great wine selection, which we enjoyed, and had a lot of tapas options. I feel they fell short, however, as far as the quality/quantity of food you receive for the price. The food was good, but average at best and you would need to order a lot to leave truly satisfied. Not sure I'll make it a point to return for anything other than a drink or two.

c-pFIMtxlNF7gu320NZK7w.text: Some friends and I were so excited to check this place out. there were 3 of us. The food came out pretty quick but our drinks didnt come out for 45 minutes. Then there was a bug in my drink. The waitress was so rude and had an attitude. The food was Gross. I'll never go back and I'll tell everyone else how horrible this place is

QUF_RxkgSH2332FRa68DXg.text: Really impressed with this spot. Ive been twice now. Both times it was slammed, but food came out quickly and the quality was top notch. Kathleen and Margaret were awesome behind the bar, and I really enjoyed the "spice rack" cocktail. Had a toddler with us the second visit, and we discovered he has a profound liking for calamari. The paella was also top notch. Cant wait to enjoy their nice patio soon. Im also a stickler for a well put together bar display. This one looked great. Kudos.

UOwBTRII3CL3wW4XKUjpVw.text: Out of everything that I enjoyed here including the octopus, the mushrooms, the atmosphere and the decor, the bartenders were my favorite hands down!  Some of the best and most professional I've ever seen.  And I'm not even a big drinker!  But they knew how to please and were extremely knowledgable.  I've been to the one in Atlanta also and Barcelona definitely lives up to the hype!

6k7RWAUOOXxnE0SJb04pdw.text: They quietly opened a week or so ago and I am guessing the secret is out. By 5:00 on Friday the place was absolutely packed. We got there just in time to grab an open table near the bar before the dining room was full. Drink service was a little slow to start, not sure really what was going on but not a huge deal as the place is new, and they were already super busy. We ordered a couple different tapas to share. The mussels with the saffron broth---mussels were good but the broth was oh so good. They bring bread to the table. You'll want the bread to dip in the broth. We also had the Cauliflower, the scallops, the Albonidgas (spiced meatballs) and the  Patatas Bravas.  There were probably at least 6 or so more dishes I'd like to also try next time plus they have a really expansive charcuterie and cheese selection. The decor is noteworthy - love the wooden tables. There is also an outdoor patio that I am sure will be popular in the spring and summer.

vHiRkC8NfkSr9QFrYQM7YA.text: Barcelona Wine Bar is everything! Great food, atmosphere and drinks. My friends and I went to celebrate a recent promotion and were impressed with the service and quality. I haven't had paella since going to Spain and their seafood paella is definitely comparable. Most of the tapas I enjoyed, the patatas bravas being my favorite. The Guns and Roses is the perfect summer drink, rose blend with bubbles. We've been twice in two weeks and plan to frequent in the upcoming months. Thoroughly enjoyed our experience!

HkS-0cyoARMFiofquWbbjA.text: This is our third time venturing out of Huntersville to come to Barcelona. Every experience has been fantastic! We sat at the bar for the first time yesterday and Kristi was fantastic! Sometimes it's really nice to be asked if you've visited a place before and even when you have, given a little tour of the ever changing menu. We had charcuterie for the first time and it was the perfect accompaniment to the wine! Another great experience and we cannot wait until brunch!

jc9rAAUZrr9IdUoLwXLOlw.text: Favorite new spot in Charlotte! Dined here Friday night with some girlfriends are ordered multiple small plates for the table. The patatas bravas and mussels were my favorite, but everything was great. Only wish the charcuterie came with crostini, but they give you bread for the table so that worked just fine. Summer Sling cocktail was delicious. Will definitely be returning soon, and requesting a table on the back patio!

tEDpMG0IHmQ6e2OngSDeAw.text: Bar None  Raises the "bar", literally and figuratively, in the QC dining and drinking scene. About time, I would add. Get ready for long waits to get in -- that is, unless you know the secret. Hip atmosphere, quality presentation, well-priced and inspired, rustic ambiance throughout. Perfect for the weathered, warehouse Design Center motif. And perhaps a chill, relaxing vibe once the curious hordes depart; try next December. Liked the bouncy, modern, hip-hop and rhythmic background music/groove -- so far. Go for it!

rZcXqXPkMQKWRnkRnSjmPQ.text: This place is amazing! We walked by a few months ago and it was under construction. Walked in tonight and the place is BEAUTIFUL!! Super crowded and a 2 hour wait, space around bar limited, but that speaks a lot for the place itself- everyone wants to try it- and I see why! The bartender was quick to serve us and gave us just what we were looking for. We met David who was super kind and helpful! We inquired about a wedding rehearsal event and he gave us information then brought us an almond, olive, and bread appetizer! It was delicious!!! We can't wait to go back during the week and try a meal!

02O29zcxfAnfbAR5ifKuxA.text: The food is excellent; however the bartender Victoria is extremely rude and ruined my experience. If I rate my experience outside her deplorable behavior, I will give you 5 stars. But if I rate it based on her service you will not get even 1. Get rid of her; she is hurting your business. I wouldn't want other patrons experience what I did. She treated me without any respect for no reason.

PCQuPF3YhQSs32tQ9vtZmw.text: I visited Barcelona for the first time last night.  There was a wait as expected for a new restaurant however the food and service was worth it.  Kasey our server did an amazing job explaining the menu and she was able to make great recommendations based on our dietary needs.  The wine list is impressive and very reasonably priced.  The restaurants menu is tapa style and it's great for groups.  I will definitely be back.

JqjzMUyLXAkA-6-QhMvuTg.text: My first time coming, and I would love to say this is my first review ever for a restaurant due to being irresistibly delicious!  I can never say everything taste amazing, but Barcelona knocked it out the park! I want to compliment the service first and foremost, Warren was attentive and had the sweetest gesture. The servers who helped brought the food in a timely manner. I was pleased with the promptness. Lastly I want to compliment the chef and say that every Tapa and dessert was on the MONEY! Definitely worth the 45 min to 1hr wait!  Buen provecho!

2fE_rBwTu2LyxC4dw-e0hw.text: Just came here for opening weekend!  We have been waiting for months for this place to open.  Food and service were AMAZING!! we were told 2-2.5 hour wait but Elizabeth was able to get us seated us early!  Thank you - you made sure we had a great experience and were able To have ample time to enjoy our meal.  Patrick made me the most amazing off the menu cocktail -  DAP Queen.  One of the best cocktails I've had in Charlotte hands down. And Meredith was a great server with really good recommendations according to our dietary restrictions (even with one off the menu item!). Joshua came by twice to see how we were doing and enjoying our meal.  Honestly, even with how packed the place was and it being opening weekend, everything seemed seamless.  They were so attentive, we never had to look or call for service for questions, and the delicious food was soooo worth the wait.  We can't wait to come back with a group of friends to try everything on the menu. Thank you Barcelona for a great date night without our little one.   Olive oil cake and chicken pimento are a must!

veuKczj-AaFBZco7ESBuhg.text: Best date night in all of Charlotte. My fiance and I come here as often as we can. We are both GF/ dairy free and find it VERY easy to eat here. The waitstaff always go out of their way to accommodate dietary restrictions. They have a beautiful cocktail menu as well, the bar tenders are all very knowledgeable and will assist with customizations. 11/10

ztVTgBrgrp7_BiTaDt8ZlA.text: New favorite place!!  Went on a Tuesday at 730 pm, waited about 20-30 minutes, but the weather was perfect so we sat on the patio while we were waiting to be seated.   We tried probably 7 or 8 dishes, it's hard to pick a favorite as all of them were amazing.  If I had to pick, I would probably say the bacon wrapped dates and shrimp were stand-outs.  And the empanadas.  And the octopus... Service was amazing - I was worried because there are usually kinks in the first few weeks (or months), but our waiters were very attentive.  Will be back very soon!

efeMoUQn0DnqY-W8iX8-IQ.text: Been here twice already. Staff is super friendly and accommodating. Food is solid, cocktails and wine selection on point. Within walking distance so it's going to give DTR a run for the money.

mat5Bl0F4MF1hHr0Gh7xEw.text: Came here for tapas and was super impressed! Every single dish we got was absolutely delicious. The service was also awesome! We came here for more of an afternoon snack since we had eaten brunch but not lunch and I really wish we had done dinner here so that I could have tried even more small plates. This is a must try for food!

SRpiWIHkso_QtO7TWMAikQ.text: This place was incredible. We waited a little longer than anticipated, and the manager immediately came over once we were seated and gave us some complimentary charcuterie. He introduced our waitress and created a standard that she would be awesome, and she was. The service was incredible. Not to mention, everything we ate was incredible. I'm a huge foodie, and I was drooling. The crudo was a crowd favorite. That drunken goat cheese was incredible. I highly recommend this place. Right down the street from where I live, so I count on coming here more frequently. New favorite and staple in my book

HADCKGaXmke6X2MZ-W4ehg.text: This review was a long time coming! I went to Barcelona Wine Bar during one of their first weeks open. Of course, it was very busy and long waits, which is expected! I was assured seating after about 1.5 hour wait, which wasn't too bad. However, it took much longer than that to the point where my friends and I decided to go elsewhere. As we were leaving to our Uber, the manager ran after us and asked us to stay. As we had made plans elsewhere, we politely declined, and she told us that next time we try Barcelona, they would have a treat for us. A couple weeks later we decide to give it another try and Barcelona went above and beyond! They had a table ready for us as we walked in - no wait. We asked our server for some vegetarian recommendations and she told us what we could eat. We order some good wine and tried some of the AMAZING tapas. As far as the treat goes - we were served pretty much every single vegetarian dish on the house. On top of that, our wine and drinks too. We were not expecting them to give us all of this (maybe just a dessert or something). I commend a restaurant or bar that goes out of its way to make sure every customer is taken care of. They did not have to give us anything, especially on a busy opening weekend where there are hundreds of patrons. Not only do they have exceptional service, but their wine selection and tapas menu is delicious and well worth it. I've been back every few weeks and it has been consistently great! Well done!

2xxCufQKVJ2n5m_ih2JQ0Q.text: Went here with my wife for a night out without the kids.  They do not take reservations so be prepared to come in early, put your name on the list, and find something to do in between.  We ended up waiting two hours to be seated so we headed to another spot to have a few drinks.    The food was good, the service was good, but our waitress made a few mistakes.  She seemed busy and a bit flustered trying to keep up.  The ambiance and the energy was fun, the music combined with the open space and number of tables makes for a louder conversation than normal, but nothing to extreme.  All in all a good spot to enjoy the evening.

s8pXAQMMA_dcacODxP9h7w.text: Delicious Spanish food for the win! It's been quite difficult to find good Spanish food in Charlotte, but Barcelona somehow hits it on the head even though they're a chain.  I love tapas-style food because you get to try so many options. They did some of the Spanish classics really well, such as the tortilla, the croquetas, and the drool-worthy patatas bravas. The menu also changes with unique dishes, which is fun!  I also thought they had a good wine menu, and I admit to drinking their delicious sangria on the porch one warm afternoon. Speaking of, I really do enjoy their outdoor patio! Definitely a hidden gem that you wouldn't know was there from the outside.

dePyH4SLkrlwtaArbtLgVA.text: Barcelona Wine Bar is a very fun new spot in Charlotte. It's still VERY busy so expect a wait. But, they have a lot of room and since it's tapas, food comes out pretty quickly.  They have a large bar where you can get drinks and food. They also have a beautiful patio. The kitchen is open, so you can watch the action, depending on where you're seated.   They have a small selection of beer and cocktails, many wines by the glass, and maaaany more wines by the bottle available. They can, of course, work with you to help you figure out what you want.   They have a decent number of options for vegetarians (not really vegans). Their patatas bravas are DELICIOUS and my favorite dish. They always have a roasted veggie option and things like hummus and other dips. And lots and lots of cheese.  The service can be slow because they're so busy but they seem to genuinely care about feedback and service so they're open to feedback!

BZue30bxehNsrg0sAs-IsQ.text: This place is amazing.   Elizabeth was managing the dining room. What a nice person. Gave us some great advice and really special treatment.  Sally and Farmer were our servers. Just, WOW! Perfect.  The food? Amazing variety, and wonderful flavors. Everything was perfect. The bread? More WOW!  Josh, the GM: Congratulations! What a well-run operation.  Scott, the Beverage Director: Superb. Great wine list, wonderful selection of Sherries, so many nice wines by the glass.  One of the most fun dining experiences EVER!  PS We prefer a little less volume on the music.

PfPfIod5hxY0CdsSxJVyHQ.text: My experience of this place was very good, however, I knocked off a star because it wasn't what I was expecting.   Atmosphere and decor is fantastic! I think it can get WAY too crowded at nights to where it's not comfortable for a chill wine place but still bearable. We ordered two tapas (empanadas and croquettes) that were excellent and the complimentary bread was delicious! The service was excellent but here's why I'm not rushing to go back:  - I ordered a cheese plate, really not that familiar with cheeses and did not get a normal charcuterie board, but instead just a block of cheese. It's not like going to some of the other wine spots in South End where my $10 can get me some cheese, meats crackers etc. it's a little more upscale cheese and that just wasn't what I was looking for but they happily sent it back and replaced it with something else . If you're into fancy cheeses, you would enjoy it.   -You can order 3oz or 6oz wine glasses and I was shocked. I for sure wasn't only getting 3oz for $6 but I feel like 6oz is pretty standard and the prices were a little high just for 3oz. I did enjoy my wine so no complaints there.  Overall if I'm going out casually to have some wine I wouldn't pick this place but for a more upscale experience, I would recommend!

ZswIHcRZDoHNZb0jNVTOgA.text: I ate here with two friends tonight, and it was an hour wait arriving at 6:15 (on a weds) to put our name in. We headed next door to superica for a drink and almost immediately got a call that our table was ready. This (and another) call/text from the restaurant were in error, but 45 mins later we were seated and given two free apps by the host for our rouge texts/calls! Additionally, the manager put in two tapas and stopped by our table (super nice)!   We split the squash hummus, artichokes, empanadas, cauliflower, Brussels, and spinach/chickpea dish and enjoyed everything! The wine selections were awesome as well, but I do wish our waitress had been more knowledgeable about the menu for a wine bar.  When we got the check, they had charged us for the apps from the manager and hadn't taken off the other two apps, but they corrected it immediately. Overall really enjoyed the food and wine and want to go back, but service definitely has some kinks to work out. Would I wait 3 hours? (the weekend wait time), no way! I'll probably wait to go again until they take reservations, but overall a great neighborhood spot

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Squash hummus
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cauliflower, Brussels, spinach/chickpeas

phU4JNAgd9YrIUz9CnJmWw.text: This place is super cool and trendy and absolutely worth going to. From the moment you step through the door to the area you sit, it's a really neat experience.  Ambiance/service: the place is super cool and trendy, and they did a great job decorating the place. Sat on the outside patio and it was perfect. The service staff is super friendly and quick to get things over  Food/drinks: the food was delicious and in tapas style. Had a lot of different varieties and every single one was super tasty and the wine is all from Spain which you can't go wrong.   I travel to Charlotte on occasion and I will come back to this place. Definitely recommend this place

-vmwbLSDcRtGSKBJRfNOUQ.text: Went on a Saturday night at 4:45 in the afternoon and there was already a 1 hour wait! The vibe at Barcelona is both urban and rustic and it's a great location to hang out for a series of small plates and drinks!  The service from Jonathan was great and the food is extremely affordable for what it is. We got the Brussels Sprouts (great char on them), pan tomate, Albondigas (our favorite dish we got - ask for some warm bread to soak up that sauce!), Patatas Bravas (they're lighter than the traditional Spanish dish, which is actually nice!), Ham and Cheese Croquettes, and Bacon Wrapped Dates (the flavor in the bacon is mouth watering). Pairing all of that with a sangria pitcher that poured about 6 glasses around and the check was still only around $80! We were also given a plate of scallops and an extra one of Brussels sprouts that were probably mistakes from the kitchen.  The wine bottle list is also relatively affordable and includes an extensive list of Spanish wines that you probably won't find at many other restaurants in Charlotte. Overall, a great experience that we'll be heading back to in the future to explore more tapas and drinks!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallops and the sangria pitcher
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon-wrapped dates
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Ham and cheese croquettes

w9Y7f3cDsnFxKZqtr1v-pQ.text: We tried Barcelona wine bar last night, about a week or so after opening. Here were our thoughts:  Service - we had a really great experience here. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu. We did go at 4:30pm so I can't say how it would be when it was packed.  Mussels - we loved these. I liked the broth especially, and my husband thought they were the best tasting/quality mussels we have had in Charlotte.  Calamari - the breading was light and crisp  Cheese options - loved them!  Brussels - these were delicious. I also loved that they were vegetarian/vegan as most Brussels sprout dishes in restaurants are cooked in some sort of pork.   Cauliflower - I loved the unique sauce on these. My husband felt so so.   Hanger steak - this was our only disappointing part of the meal. The presentation was subpar and the portion size was smaller than we expected. It was delicious but we probably would not order this again.  Beverages - we each tried a cocktail and a wine flight. We loved the idea of a wine flight and enjoyed trying different types of wine. My husband got the gin and tonic cocktail. He was not a fan of it, although a gin and tonic is also his drink of choice and I think he was expecting it to taste differently. I forgot the name of my cocktail (it was the one with grapefruit) and I thought it was delicious.  Overall thoughts of this restaurant - Barcelona is a great addition to South End. The bar looked fun, the food was great, and we had good service. Our only complaint or suggestion to the restaurant is that the 2-seater tables in the back beside the kitchen are super close together to the point where we felt uncomfortable once people were seated on both sides of us. Maybe they should consider removing one of the small tables and spacing the rest out a little bit more. Otherwise we thought it was great!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Hanger steak
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cocktail
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cauliflower &amp; mussels

qJu-aHHLI2hCiyIOiLha9g.text: Super cute spot in SouthEnd. We went early and there was no wait for a table but there was not a seat open at the bar and by the time we left it was packed. We tried the meatballs- very good sauce cooked to perfection, pork belly - awesome flavor and good portion, ceviche- fresh light lime flavor and lastly the empanadas- the crust was perfection and filling fantastic. You have to get the scallops for sure! The drinks were all incredible and we loved the decor. I will be returning!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

exinBWIPbpUbTcxy5ywbdg.text: The food is good, but the dessert is great =D  I've been to Barcelona a couple times and I love the ambiance and vibe there. I dislike the ridiculous wait times, but I guess that's the price you pay if you want to enjoy an evening of food and drinks in a lively poppin' spot.  Be warned that their food is on the saltier side (or at least that has been my experience with at least 8 of the 10 dishes I've tried there) they have a good menu with a great variety of dishes - everything from charcuterie & gambas to salads and paella, and while I would not say the food is authentic Spanish by any means, it's still decent. The highlight for me however, is the dessert menu! from the olive oil cake to the crepes, everything on there is good.   Definitely a place worth checking out. Put your name on the list, go grab a drink somewhere close by to kill the 2 hours you're going to have to wait (especially if it's a weekend night), and then come back and enjoy a late dinner :)

wXqQQ6ID79X5hmC8eysfPg.text: We came here on a late Saturday afternoon, right after they opened. It was already packed! We grabbed a spot at the bar and took in the eclectic menu. I ordered the seasonal caipi porto which was absolutely delicious. The bartender modified the drink to use regular oranges instead of blood oranges (trust me, this is a good idea). A very light, refreshing beverage. We ordered tapas- oysters, scallops and the potato tortilla. The potato tortilla is like a quiche and it's divine. The scallops were perfect with a cauliflower puree. The oysters had bone marrow crumbles on top and we felt that it muted the flavor too much. We also ordered the olive oil cake. I want to have a cake shipped to me weekly. This is like a sweet and salty cornbread cake. You need to eat this cake! Highly recommend this place. I loved the decor throughout and their patio is perfect for outdoor dining.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seasonal Caipi Porto

yX01f3cjVcJLxlc7sdf2Lg.text: Great wine, great tapas and great concept!   First off, I am a  sucker for a place that has good ambiance and decor. This place has it down to the littlest details. It is dimly lit and cozy! Perfect for a wine night to catch up with the girls or a romantic date night.  Second, the wine and food is reasonably priced and good! They also offer wine by smaller ounces so you can try something adventurous without having to commit to a full glass of something less than desirable. We ordered the calamari and scallops to share with a friend and it was delicious. Especially the creamy dipping sauce that came with the calamari! I was even dipping my bread in it!  The only down side, which is I guess a testament to how good the place is, is how busy it is and how long we had to wait! It is good and I definitely plan on coming back but I am hoping that the popularity will die down a little bit so the restaurant is not packed like sardines. I recommend coming at an off time!

j11d9BIU6-P8j4TP_p5uPQ.text: My friend has been telling me to come here for weeks and I see why! Beautiful atmosphere great wine and tapas. The bacon wrapped dates are amazing and the sangria pitcher is to die for. I think what made my experience the best is bartender Sean. He was very friendly and answered any questions we had. He was also very knowledgeable and I could tell he know what he was talking about. He had a smile on his fave the whole time and I could tell he impacted all of his other customers the same way he did me. I will definitely come back. Thank you so much Sean you are THE BEST.

ig67V3bZoa-UJ1I273SCgQ.text: I love their DC location, so having this gem in Charlotte is giving me all the feels! If you need me this Summer you will probably find me feasting and drinking a bottle of wine on their patio, along with the rest of Charlotte. This place stays packed, so just keep that in mind when making plans. But honestly the people watching here is everything, so the wait may be worth it in ogling lol.  Let's get to the menu, it's a wine bar so their staff is very knowledgeable and can guide you if need be, so don't feel intimidated. The food is designed to share, so don't bring your picky friends, j/k you can bring them. Since no dish is left unflavored, everyone should have something they can't get enough of. And the waiters are pretty savvy about what those dishes are and will recommend you may want two of a certain plate.  Scallops, meatballs and brussel sprouts were all I could fit this visit but I'll be back for more....

ABSSMmluz84NPCCBJYYxhg.text: I could eat here every night it was SO GOOD. Everything was reasonably priced, including the wine, and the food was to die for. Obviously there was a 45 min wait but it was so worth it.   I couldn't pick a favorite between everything we ordered ... -croquettes (so rich and amazing) -brocollini (refreshing and spicy)  -bikini (always amazing) -bacon wrapped dates (sweet and bae) -Brussels sprouts (crispy af) -spicy beef empanadas (surprising winner) -patatas bravas (sauce is amazing)  -MEATBALLS   wow I'm really fired up now... that was amazing food and I can't wait to come back!!!! Thank you for opening in CLT!

FIkGyQ0pabgN29WymrQK9w.text: Start to finish, decor to dining, everything about Barcelona is intentional and incredible. We arrived around 4:45p on Friday and did not need a reservation. By the time we left around 6:30p, the restaurant was packed. My mom and I ordered a variety of tapas, charcuterie and cheese, paella to share, a pitcher of sangria and flan with coffee to finish. Total with tip came to $140 and we left full to the brim! Our waitress, Elaine, was helpful and gave great suggestions since w where first timers.   I would strongly recommend upgrading to the pitcher of sangria is you plan to drink more than two glasses each. It's a very generous sized pitcher. The calamari are so good you'll want multiple portions if you're sharing with more than two people, the smoky Marcona almonds would be awesome as a snack to go with a beer. We also had the croquettes. - cheesy, crunchy, meaty, potato nuggets with lemon aioli? Yes, please! The more you drink the better these would get! The paella comes with plenty of seafood and could definitely use a bit more rice. The only downside of our whole meal was that it was a bit well done. I like that it had the crust traditionally associated with properly made paella, it just needed a 1/2 cup more soft rice on top. I can't really call this a complaint as I was already so full of delicious and flavorful food at that point in our meal. For dessert we ordered the flan and two espresso drinks. The flan is small and thick with a creme brulee type creaminess. Perfect portion after such a filling meal. Heads up! If you order a cortado, it comes in an espresso sized mug.

4dVri_h0-WOwh2vjn33OBQ.text: I had an amazing experience at Barcelona.  We arrived around 5:40 p.m. on a Friday -- we were told there was a 20 minute wait (we considered ourselves lucky).  Even luckier, two seats opened at the bar and we grabbed those.  The bartender greeted us right away and got a pitcher of red sangria started.  The sangria was very, very tasty.  We ordered the flank steak, scallops, cauliflower, gambas, albondigas, fabada and redfish a la plancha.  The steak, scallops, gambas and fabada were absolutely outstanding.    The fresh, warm bread was amazing.  The cauliflower was the only thing that was a bit mediocre.    By the time we left, it was standing room only and probably a 2-hour wait.  Get there early or be okay with a wait - it will be worth it!

Wk5auJ0_DGz0b2cHQfMT3A.text: 4 Stars for food 3 stars for service / atmosphere   The food was absolutely delicious!! Highly recommend: Hanger steak Bacon wrapped dates Spanish tortilla Potatoes  Truffle bikini   The atmosphere is a little weird to be honest. I thought the decor was random - half antique, half rustic, half artsy. It's so LOUD. We skipped out on dessert because we just wanted to get out of there. The service is pretty slow too. Although everyone is friendly.  Probably would go back for the food but would have to be prepared for a long, loud night.

m4lJcZuL51orafnR4aW4uQ.text: This place was everything I hoped it would be.  The food was good, the wine list was spectacular and the people who were in that place were BEAUTIFUL.  Such a diverse, eclectic group of people.  It was amazing.    The sommelier came over and talked to us for a while and that was awesome.  That wine list was like no other place I'd seen.  The food was also VERY good.  It was late at night so we didn't try a whole lot but we did get the empanadas, Brussels sprouts and the calamari .    There was a TWO HOUR wait at 7pm which was understandable.  we put our name down and then walked over to Common Market and had some "pre game" snacks.  I would definitely go earlier than later and would also uber if you don't live in south end.   Sooooo can't wait to go back.  This place is already exploding and it's only been a week!

j8Sq-pEr_9tq_3QJrjYIPg.text: I came with my boss excited to try this place before going to an event. We didn't have much time to enjoy the atmosphere as we would have liked, but our server was wonderful. She listened to what we liked and made recommendations based on that. We ordered wine and then decided to share several plates, including the hummus (amazing!!!), meatballs (also delicious), the potatoes (yum) and scallops. The scallops were slow to arrive, but our server did check on them as soon as we brought it to her attention and ran the plate out ASAP. The interior is lovely and the patio looked fabulous, so I can't wait to come back and sit out there.

0Zn3OCLHeRom7lxQzCqAIw.text: All I can say is, try the Scallops!   Barcelona is a romantic, beautiful wine bar in the heart of South End! Cheers.

imUsE9SwF6LUT-rtMgg6_A.text: This place was amazing! Each dish seemed to be better than the last. The husband and I went for a date night here and really enjoyed ourselves. We wanted to try everything but we were stuffed! Both of our favorite tapa was the scallop dish. I cannot rant and rave about it enough. The perfectly peppered crunchy searing and how it was cooked to perfection. I'll be back for that alone! We also had the white beans (amazing flavor), the salmon (So, so fresh and delicious) and the croquetas (OMG TO DIE FOR!).  We started with the shishito peppers (I personally like them more on the charred side but these were still a tasty snack) and some meat and cheese. The spicy spreadable salami, sobresata and aged manchego were a phenomenal start to the meal. Even the bread and olive oil they set out for the table is packed full of flavor and executed without flaw.    I honestly can't wait to spend many more evenings on the patio enjoying this culinary jewel. They have a wonderful wine list and I intend to try as many as possible. I can't wait for them to start serving brunch!  As a side note:: they have the most beautiful and clean bathrooms I've seen at a restaurant. They are gorgeous.

hTYBKvkT22sCECor846sKw.text: Amazing place & I will definitely return!  Barcelona was PACKED when I arrived with my bf last friday at 7:30 pm. Thank God we called in ahead of time to put down a reservation because if we hadn't, who knows how long we would've had to wait.   Anyways, once we were seated, the service was amazing. Our waitress came over and asked us if we had any dietary restrictions, and since I had a few (allergic to all nuts & vegetarian), she took my menu and crossed out the food items that I wouldn't be able to eat. That was amazing! While she crossed out the items that I wasn't able to eat, it was still tough to find vegetarian items that would fill me up properly. We opted for a few small plates that did eventually fill us up.  For the tapas, we ordered broccoli, asparagus, and one other thing that I just can't remember. Our waiter brought out bread and olive oil for us - this was delicious. I probably enjoyed the bread more than I did the tapas. But, the wines we ordered were insanely delicious as well. We ordered a glass of Cabernet Blend and a glass of Garnacha Blend.   I definitely will come back for wine & cheese, and definitely some warm bread!

5eTsve8v2ARcqAoV3YjqRA.text: Great vibe, big wine menu, incredible sharables (and a lot of them), quaint and private patio, huge inside space and bar. This is the perfect spot for drinks or a night out. The experience is in line and even better than what I've had at their other location in DC.   If the name didn't give it away, this is a Spanish wine bar/restaurant, so you can find many popular Spanish dishes with a modern twist and a great Spanish wine menu. There are so many sharables to choose from with reasonable prices, and all come out at a good time and spread out enough that you don't feel like you're overwhelmed. If you're going for dinner, 3 tapas is enough to fill up one person, but they're at a good price point and a decent size that you don't break the bank and don't feel over stuffed. They also have entree style dishes, like whole fish and paella! And who doesn't love delicious complimentary bread and oil to start a night off?!  Being in South End, it's a little difficult to find parking and the restaurant can get super crowded pretty quickly at peak times, so make reservations if you can or come a little early.
