NwFW02XLalA41p0dd8Setg.text: Barcelona was super packed when I arrived with my gf about a month ago on a Friday at 7:30 pm. I called in ahead of time to put down a reservation because I attempted to come here when they first opened, and the wait was more than 2 hours.   The service was amazing. Our waitress came over and asked us if we had any dietary restrictions, and since my gf had a few (allergic to all nuts & vegetarian), she took her menu and crossed out the food items that she wouldn't be able to eat. That was an amazing gesture especially since a lot of the menu items are hard to decipher.   For the tapas, we ordered broccoli, asparagus, and one other plate that I can't recall. Our waiter brought out bread and olive oil for us which was warm and delicious. The wines we ordered were insanely tasty as well. We ordered a glass of Cabernet Blend and a glass of Garnacha Blend. I wonder if they have wine flights - not sure because I didn't ask. Next time, I definitely want to try out the cheeses. Can't wait to come back and try more tapas & more wines!

vSbTPqBgm-__Vm8g0p-mkg.text: We'd been wanting to try Barcelona since they opened a couple of months ago, but weren't able to get in on previous tries, as they don't accept reservations (yet), and are very popular.  The Design Center area is hopping now, due to the openings of Superica, Barcelona, Hawker's Street Fare, and Jeni's Splendid Ice Cream.  We finally ventured over early one Saturday evening for dinner, and were able to get seated immediately.  They have an outdoor patio, but it appeared to be mostly uncovered.  Since the sun was very bright, we didn't ask to sit outside.  We were seated near the open kitchen, and enjoyed watching the hustle and efficiency of their staff.  We ordered the artichokes, grilled scallops, octopus, and hanger steak.  We were lucky that the plates were spaced nicely apart in their delivery, as we had a small table with little room for more than one plate.  But since this is a tapas restaurant, you can expect to get the food as soon as it's ready.  They'll give you a delicious basket of bread while you wait with crusty, warm sourdough and olive oil for dipping.  The artichokes were nicely grilled, but I wasn't fond of the sweet sauce that accompanied them, and just ate them without.  They were still seasoned and very good!  Next came the octopus.  It was served coated and deep fried, with a couple of small potatoes.  The seasoning was delicious (although just a tad salty), and the octopus was cooked perfectly.  The scallops came next.  They were cooked through but still fork tender.  They were served on top of a pea puree that had mint in it and was very refreshing.  Finally, the hanger steak was delivered with five small slices, topped with a truffle vinaigrette.  It was cooked rare, so my husband loved it.  I'll bet they would cook it more of you like, but he said it was cooked perfectly for that cut of meat, and it was his favorite dish of the night.  I think I preferred the octopus, but the scallops were a close second.  For our beverages, I had a vodka grapefruit beverage, and my husband had a gimlet.  Both were very good.  Service was exceptional.  There was always someone keeping an eye on our table and clearing off plates when we were done to make room for the next one.   Even with the area's popularity, don't fret about the parking.  Parking is available on the street (if you arrive early), in a lot across from the restaurant, or in the Design Center parking garage just off Worthington.  The garage is $5 on evenings and weekends, and we prefer to park here.   We will most definitely be back!

wPfO4VNbapJQyDhb7rMp2A.text: This place is heavenly!  I could stop there, but why not go on?!  I came here last Wednesday night (March 6th '19) with two girlfriends for "dinner" (more commonly called tapas & wine here)!   We were seated at a wonderful table JUST next to the open kitchen and ended up with two waitresses (one a trainee)... Everyone seemed to know the menu and wine list quite well!  Almost immediately, a plate of grilled hanger steak with truffle vinaigrette was sat in front of us... we didn't order it... it was complimentary... the chef called it "kitchen love"... I'm a fan! :)  We ordered wine and a wine flight for tasting (very clever), and proceeded to order two trays... one with three cheeses, the other with three meats... fresh bread and delicious olive oil was put on the table, and we started to chow...  We realized quickly that the cheeses, meats, and bread were filling us up FAST!  (A rookie mistake, maybe, but I regret NOTHING!).  We ordered croquettes as well (because we had to get ONE other tapa) and some more bread and wine..   I cannot tell you how amazing the food was... just delightful.  But it was more than that.  The experience at Barcelona was a joy.  From seating to wait staff to food to drink and on... we were overjoyed!  To say "I'll be back" is an understatement... I CAN'T WAIT to go back! :)

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. We&#39;re at the table nearest a VERY welcoming open kitchen!

DgzlHK92M16RVT38VQkeNw.text: My friends invited me here for an early dinner. Barcelona is difficult to spot from the street unless you're paying close attention.  Everything was delicious. The chef even sent us out extra calamari, which was perfect. My drink was interesting. The Brussels sprouts weren't too charred. Our scallops tasted good, but the portion was small with three medium sized scallops. 5 would be appropriate. Papas had a great sauce. Almost everything comes with an aioli.   Service was great, and everyone was so nice. The food came out quickly. Considering it's a new restaurant, they skipped the growing pains and are running smoothly. On my way out, I saw a fish entree that looked great. I'll be back to go beyond tapas and have a full dinner.

3W2krZtF2t_9Kc6Er_uk1w.text: We loved this place! We arrived early and the staff immediately found a chair for my mom to keep comfortable while we waited! So thoughtful! We were seated in the quietest part of restaurant and had a delightful experience! The food was great! The sangria greT! We will be back! Laure

NCPHGdK0U-_Cqib1tKEtYA.text: The food is absolutely amazing however the portions are very small, would recommend not splitting a majority of plates with more than 3 people.  Best potatoes bravas I've had in a long time! The cheeseboard was fantastic and they have a great selection to choose from.  Got the spreadable meat and it was a hit.

YCLb9dxBwXIlh9rJcEuGqg.text: OK - it's taken me wayyyyy to long to write this review, but I was here opening week and it didn't disappoint! Even opening week the service was impeccable. I sat at the bar and had the most phenomenal service. The bartenders were brought in from other Barcelona restaurants to assist with opening week (genius idea) and this was obvious because they knew what they were doing / recommending! Since then, I've been back four times and haven't been disappointed!   The only downside is the wait/bar seats. It's always a long wait and 3-4 people deep at the bar. TIP: If you come here, don't be upset with people who stand behind you at the bar. I had some women upset with me for standing behind them.....when the line was 4-5 people deep. Seriously?? Enjoy life and just drink your wine, at least you're seated! :)   Definitely come here for a date night or girls night out if you haven't been. Cheers!

i8dnpA97UyoxLkN6u5DEqw.text: Welcome to Charlotte, Barcelona! I originally went to Barcelona when visiting DC and was completely blown away! Had the pleasure of dining with the Southend location twice now since it's opening, and both times were with a group of 10+ foodies! I have to say the first time was a bit underwhelming, but tonight is swaying me a bit closer to the dark side! With a table of 11, the attentiveness of the staff was absolutely incredible! It was so great that I really wish I caught the name of our sweet waitress!   This is really a 3.5 star review and it's not because Barcelona isn't great, it's because I've had some amazing tapas in my lifetime. At this point, I'm pretty sure I've tried 90% of the dishes so below are a list of the best, the good and the not so great:  Best - Lamb Pintxos (perfect flavor and texture)  - Scallops (just melts in your mouth!) - Patatas Bravas (that sauceee! I could live in this!) - Oysters (perfect blend of textures and subtle flavors. Dish came with 3 and I so wanted more!) - Potato Tortilla (light, fluffy perfection) - Jamon y Manchego Coqueta (can you really go wrong with croquettes?) - Sangria (I've tried both the red and white and you really can't go wrong!)  Good - Littleneck clams - Mussels  - Mushrooms a la Plancha (seriously, how do you make mushrooms taste so delicious?!) - Albondigas (meatballs.. not my favorite but def a table favorite!) - Cauliflower a la Plancha (that sauceeee) - Paella (for a place named after Barcelona, the paella should be out of this world.. and it's not, but it's decent)  Not so great - Red Snapper Crudo (extremely fishy and not very original compared to the other dishes.  - Eggplant Caponata (not terrible, not great. We had lots of this dish left over)  Dessert Our waitress was kind enough to let us try all of the desserts in honor of the birthday girl! We ordered most of the menu and as you can imagine, was completely stuffed! Let's just say we made room for all of the below and would probably eat another round if it landed in front of us. Loved everything! - Flan (literally the best flan I've ever had. Would count this as a fooe group if I could)  - Olive Oil Cake (surprisingly amazing! - Cheesecake (devineeee)  Thank you for such a memorable experience, Barcelona.

-N699cvQhMe9gBKHANV9Pg.text: This place was HOPPING.  I cannot believe they could crowd as many people around the bar.  Part of me wonders what would have happened had there been a fire.  The restaurant was so full of people.   No matter what part of the restaurant you were in, people were coming out of the woodwork.  We were seated in the back and it was so loud that the server had a difficult time making herself heard.  We started with the sangria. I had the red because I was intrigued that it had guava juice in it.  I will admit, it went down fast!  The tapas started coming fairly quickly.  We had the spinach and chick peas, okra and corn, Mahon cheese and bread, veggie paella, and a chicken dish served in a yummy sauce with some thinly sliced potatoes.  It was all very good.  The atmosphere was electric.  Maybe a bit too electric for my digestion!  This is a place suited so well for millennials. We felt OLD, as the twenty and thirties crowd dominated the space.  Did I mention there were lots of them?  Good food, though I am not a fan of small plates. I prefer having a big plate of food in a quiet atmosphere.  I guess that's just the old in me.

xAA4pKMrzF1w8mGt6mDR0A.text: I came here with three friends last weekend and it was amazing! We arrived around 6 pm on a Saturday and the wait was only 40/45 minutes. We grabbed some cocktails from the bar and went outside to sit at a community table while we waited. Our cocktails were incredible and we were even brought some bread to munch on! The patio area is BEAUTIFUL and before we knew it our table was ready.  The food here is out of this world. The friends I ate here with studied abroad in Spain in college and they were freaking out because they said this is the first time they've found a restaurant in America that compared to what they ate when they were there. We shared a bunch of tapas including the patatas bravas, brussles sprouts, and mushrooms a la plancha. I was full after sharing two small plates with the table and two small plates with my boyfriend.   There is a sommelier that walks around the restaurant and helps you pair drinks with your food (which is incredibly helpful when the wine list has nearly 400 wines). He suggested a dessert wine pairing with the flan that we can't stop talking about. I can't explain why but it was one of the best things I've ever had. This restaurant is an incredible South End addition, we are already planning our next trip back!

niN8THjYAH3vjgQ1wS4ggQ.text: If we could give this place 6 stars we would! We started our anniversary dinner at The Crunkleton and after a disappointing experience decided to leave before ordering entrees. Checked BWB and they had an open table! The vibe is chill, the hostesses were super friendly, our waitress Aeverie was over the top awesome.  We ordered some Spanish and Portuguese wines and a variety of tapas plates. The hangar steak w truffle was out of this world and our favorite dish for sure. Meatballs were juicy, the Brussels had just the right amount of char but still tender.  We mentioned it was our anniversary and they ended our meal with a complimentary champagne and sorbet treat. We weren't expecting that at all. The Crunkleton didn't even acknowledge the special occasion and it was noted on our reservation. Barcelona is hands down our new date night spot. Can't wait to go back and try the rest!

M6V46Qu5GccAy5YVEBqApg.text: Just opened and already a new favorite!  I tend to not visit places right when they open to allow them to get out the opening jitters. However, I really wanted to check this place out. We were blown away!!!   The location is excellent. We can walk here from our house, which I'm pretty pumped about. But also, the atmosphere is beautiful. I love all the woodwork in the bar.   We sat at the bar and were immediately greeted and helped. I decided to try the red sangria, which is made in house, and I loved it. Definitely one of the top ones I've had in town. My husband got a glass of wine, and we enjoyed the wine selection as well. I was hesitant to try a cocktail as this is a wine bar, but I did and loved my drink. It was the spice rack.   They provide you with bread that is made in house and olive oil. It's delicious. We began to order tapas. It comes out when it's done, which I love. We had the albondigas (meatballs), croquettes, brussel sprouts, hangar steak with truffle aioli, and oysters from what they call "the box." They've got a wood fired oven they use for a few dishes, and they call it "the box."  We enjoyed all of our dishes, and they didn't feel too overpriced.   They also had a very nice selection of meats and cheeses. A bit expensive if you want a full board, but still a good option.   They also have more substantial meals, like paella, that can be shared between two. We didn't try this, but I'd be curious to in the future. Costs more, but it seems like it'd be a nice portion.   We took the olive oil cake home. It was a large piece. I loved it, but my husband felt it was a bit savory with the salt.   The best part was the service! We asked a lot of questions, and Josh answered all of our questions with confidence. He could describe every wine, every meat, every cheese, and every cocktail. He was very attentive and so pleasant. He's here from Boston assisting with the opening. I'm sad he won't be here permanently, but if he's training the staff, we have great things to look forward to.

yg6MTTNGaREQHKY5JeJpzQ.text: Finally got to try this hot new restaurant in Charlotte! Made a reservation online and confirmed from a phone call a couple hours before dining. Seamless process. You can request to sit on the patio for outside dining.  Cocktails are amazing and probably my favorite part of my dining experience. They let us sample the white and red sangria which was a tad too sweet for me. However, my friend ordered the Guns and Roses sangria and it was fantastic! Only complaint on the seasonal cocktail I tried were the amount of seeds from the jalapenos. There were so many I contemplated getting a spoon to scoop them out. The bourbon cocktail was light and refreshing. My friend doesn't enjoy bourbon and actually ordered it after trying mine.  As for food, the best thing I tried was the scallops! They had a little heat to them but were good all the same.

2euSts5Ge-it_n8Zv6_YOw.text: My friends and I went here last night and highly recommend everyone goes! This is a place Charlotte needs more of!  We waited about 1.5-2hours for a table but it went by super quickly as we grabbed drinks from the bar and weren't in a huge rush. The Gm Josh told us that they will have a reservation system in a few wee. The bar was well staffed to handle the influx of people that were waiting for a table.  We got a great variety from the meat and cheese plate and I've tried something different each time I've gone and haven't been disappointed. Huge fan of the lomo and 9-Month Aged Manchego.  On the tapas side, I highly recommend the grilled flank steak, patatas bravas, and Albondigas (meatballs).  Lastly, get the olive oil cake with vanilla ice cream! Absolutely delicious.  All in all, this was an amazing experience and I am happy Charlotte has a place with this atmosphere, drinks, and food. I now understand why the wait was so long because not only are the foods & drink delicious, but you don't want to leave because you are having so much fun.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

6oRJHj63n9D8oVEKyQXQDw.text: I've been here twice now and have had a really good experience and kind of a poor one.  I ordered the pork belly after the waitress said it was really good, because I love pork belly.  Honestly, it was the worst pork belly I've ever had.  It's served in a broth so it soggy and tasted like i was eating wet chicken.  They took it back and i order the steak. It was just okay as well.  It also took them about 15 mins to get a beer that i order from the bar.  The staff was very nice and helpful it sounds like the back of the house needs some work though.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork belly. I had to send it back. It was soggy and lacked flavor

YY039XljFHjOmwfwXgxavg.text: I was excited to try this place out and finally made it on Sunday for a girls night.  Luckily at 6 pm on Sunday we got seated almost right away.  I was nervous because I had heard of 2 hour waits on Friday.   Here's my thoughts on the overall experience: Ambiance - the restaurant has a cool vibe and I liked the decor, my only comment is the music seemed just a tab loud. I can appreciate some music, but I like to hold a conversation at a normal level.   Drinks - they had a decent list of cocktails to choose from but our waitress wasn't too up to speed on these.  I did love how you can make your own wine flight, that is a plus although a tad pricey.  Overall great selection of wines.  Food - was decent overall. I was surprised by the cheese & charcuterie, as it wasn't served with any crackers or anything else, just cheese and meat. Also it appeared none of our dishes were served with serving utensils. Had to cut through the thicker cheese with a butter knife and used our forks to serve all of our other dishes.  We also tried the Brussels which were good and well cooked, the bacon wrapped dates which were also pretty good.  The croquettes were decent and the beats were pretty good as well.  Nothing stood out as being amazing however.   Overall a decent experience, but if you have more than a glass of wine, the bill can add up quickly without realizing it!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Build your own wine flight

9-r4aTRsjP5OL2S3zq9aMQ.text: Run, do not walk, do not even power walk: sprint! Tapas on tapas on tapas, incredible selection of drinks and the most fun atmosphere. I came here to celebrate an engagement recently and it was the perfect night. We were seated outside, and while the lights and decor are cute, it is August in the south. The heat (no fans outside) was the only downfall.   We were with a group and did the $35 deal.. which is a steal! TONS of food and the server picked which saved us the whole discussion of what everyone wanted and didn't want. It made the entire evening stressless and everything we had was incredible.   The food was to die for, but the service was what really brought it home. Asha -- I know im butchering the spelling-- you made all of our dreams come True. And Jaime, couldn't forget you, Jaime. Friendly, attentive, personable, accommodating and helpful. They knew the menu forward and backwards, brought out the most amazing things and made the whole evening amazing. I requested to add jalapenos to the Paloma (delicious by the way) and the first was perfect. the 2nd drink came with 1 million jalapeno seeds which made it so, so spicy. I wasn't planning on saying anything, especially because I asked to add jalapenos, but as soon as Asha saw the drink sitting on the table (someone else brought it out) she immediately apologized, got me a new drink and the bartender even brought it out herself. The remade drink was perfect. It was obvious it was a simple oversight and their recovery was amazing.   I can't stress enough how accommodating the entire staff was. It made the night filled with good drinks, and amazing food that much better.

Yg9KcZtMuh8i5O8PsokTZQ.text: Id say 3.5 to 4 honestly. First the place has a nice feel to it, and the service was REALLY good! Our server took extra time to explain things to anyone who had questions and even helped my mother in law pick out a wine that suited her tastes (which she ended up loving and ordering a second glass). And she even comp'd us a dessert (the olive oil cake which was really yummy!) As far as food we got the following: bacon wrapped dates, drunken goat cheese, red snapper crudo, calamari, scallops, octopus, potato tortilla, albondigas, croquetas, patatas bravas, pork pintxos. Nothing was bad at all, but not much stood out either. I would say the two things that stood out to me the most ( had the most flavor) were the pork pintxos and the octopus. The two things i thought were skippable were the drunken goat cheese and the crudo, neither had any real flavor. The rest of everything was yummy but nothing id rush back for. Overall it was a fun outing with a group because tapas are always fun imo.

ySKGnO4K9OalTGbrmS-PTA.text: Came with family for an early Saturday dinner. I'll start with the reservation process, which I have to say was a little odd and annoying. First of all, they're not on Open Table and didn't answer the first time I called. Secondly, even though I called 5 days ahead of time, there were no reservations available between 5:00 and 9:45. Thirdly (and strangest of all), I got a confirmation phone call the day before and then 2 different confirmation texts the day of. I clearly indicated over the phone and on the first text that we would be keeping the reservation. Anyway, not a big deal but definitely the most over-the-top reservation confirmation process I've ever experienced.  Now on to the food. The 6 of us shared about a dozen different tapas and although there were some standouts, there were too many mediocre dishes to warrant 5 stars. My favorites were the Pork Pintxos, Patatas Bravas, Croquetas, and Bacon-Wrapped Dates. The pork had the perfect char and heat level. It was universally loved at our table. I'm not usually a big fan of potatoes, but I kept going back for more of the Patatas Bravas. So much so that I had to skip the last couple dishes altogether. The biggest disappointments were the Drunken Goat Cheese, Potato Tortilla, and Red Snapper Crudo.  The ambiance and service were both top notch. The waitress humored my father with his dad jokes and even brought us a complimentary slice of olive oil cake for dessert. Overall a pretty solid restaurant but not quite as good as I hoped.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Albondigas
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Pork Pintxos
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spice Rack

Rhklg7S3V46UHJEh3TT_hw.text: This place is so impressive! The service is superb, the ambiance is amazing, and the food is delicious.   Since this place opened 6 months ago, I've visited at least 10 times. Their cocktails are amazing - a pitcher of sangria is perfect for sharing and so reasonably priced. My favorite of their tapas are the meatballs, the whipped cheese, the ham and truffle sandwich, the croquets, the bacon wrapped dates, and so many more!   This place is intimate - think small tables and close proximity to other guests. It's also fairly noisy, so keep this in mind if you're wanting to have a private, quiet conversation.   Your going to want to make a reservation if you don't want to wait. This place is awesome and I'm so glad it's in my neighborhood!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

LdIp-ZJCJMEucNbWg79zyA.text: Okay guys some friends of ours brought us here for anniversary and i have to say this place is worth the wait, on the weekends be ready to wait for at least one hour until there is a table ready for you BUT its worth it. From the host to the team of Barcelona they are great at what they do.   Kasey was our server and she was on it, the food we had was amazing and she made great suggestions, the ladies had a Rose sangria that it was amazing, our choices that night was the following: tapas, TWO orders of empanadas, the asparagus and the mussels for the entre we had the seafood paella. Everything was amazing. One tip keep the mussels broth and dip the bread in it. Kasey will keep filling up that bread basket  They offer you still and sparkling water which to my opinion is awesome. My wife and i were celebrating our 19th year anniversary and the whole staff presented my wife with a Barcelona book with everyone's signature and we got a special note from Kasey our server. Honestly this was a great surprise to us and we loved it. They also gave us a dessert sample which included the following: Olive oil cake, flourless chocolate cake and a flan.   I have to say this has been one of the best experiences i have had in a restaurant, you can tell everyone in this restaurant loves what they do. I will definitely be coming back to this place.   Thanks guys!!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Happy 19th Anniversary / dessert platter
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Seafood Paella

vUxUB1waZpGeViYo6qQwKg.text: Decided to come to Barcelona after an afternoon of climbing. Found out about this restaurant through Yelp.  I went to Spain in April and still continue to go through tapas withdrawals. I read the place can get busy, so I recommend making reservations. Our server was very friendly and helpful. I just wish the restaurant wasn't so loud. One of my friends could barely hear our server when she spoke.   We were given the blowfish as compliments from the chef.  We also ordered the seafood paella, patates braves, calamari, and truffle bikini.  The seafood paella was slightly bland and a little overcooked.  The rest of the food was good, especially the potatoes!  I wish the menu was more descriptive. Each tapas simply lists the ingredients. For example, I didn't know a bikini was a sandwich, I simply knew it contained truffle, jamon, garlic aoli in the dish. It would be nice if the menu was a little more detailed in that regard.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Paella mariscos
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fried calamari
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Patates braves

f9ep0n3PFM9cOmLbMvsVYQ.text: We came here to celebrate my birthday and I was not disappointed. We went on a Sunday, but I still made a reservation just in case. It was dead when we arrived but picked up as it got later.   All of the staff were exceptional. SO FRIENDLY and sweet and helpful. I wanted to be friends with all of them. Our server and her assistant server were awesome.   We ordered two drinks and 3 tapas and our bill was about $50 so it wasn't unreasonable. We ordered meatballs, hanger steak and croquettes which were all really yummy. Our friends ordered the shrimp, hummus, and potato tortilla and ended up feeling sick the next day so not sure about those.   Indoor, patio and bar seating are all available and the inside is rustic and cool. Definitely try it out!

LkNHGRuqwsMbP4PAOxG7gw.text: It's not one thing that makes a great night out. Barcelona hit the right notes for a memorable date night.  Yous should know this place is LOUD. And crowded. I made a 7:45pm reservation on a Wed. and still had to wait 10-15 minutes for a table - mid-week. We got a delicious cocktail at the bar while we waited. A word on those cocktails, wine felt like a better value here. The cocktail pours were in a small glass and the glass was 1/2 to 3/4 full for both cocktails we ordered.  Once seated we were brought warm bread and complimentary sparkling water. Jamie was our waiter and he had timing, charm, everything. He made me a custom wine flight based on my taste and ordered it from lightest to most complex. We ordered and our initial food came right out. Then a thunderstorm hit and we waited and waited and waited. I saw the manager on duty carrying tables into the dining room from the courtyard and holding umbrellas for guests in her business clothes, with a smile.  Jamie lept into action bringing us complimentary items and dessert. He salvaged what could have been a night spent listening to my husband's stomach growl and instead we left very happy. The food here is great and there are vegetarian options. Come with people you like as you have to get close to hear them. Next time we'll sit in the courtyard.

kj3H9KiUvD-227NyAr_NCQ.text: Friday 8pm.  Crappy club music so obnoxiously loud I can't hear anyone at my table.  Frustrating when you're taking your parents to a nice dinner.    It's impossible to have a real conversation in these kinds of places that try too hard to make it a nightclub environment.  87db according to a typical iPhone app (db Level Pro).  People at tables on either side of us were literally screaming in order to be heard by their own table.    Service was excellent.  Outstanding, actually.  Food is good.  The fancier the house water, which is allegedly triple distilled, the cleaner the glasses should be.  Menu items need more detail like what has onions or what kind of cheese.  Wish they wouldn't put the garlic aoli under every dish, especially the croquettes and sandwiches.  It's like they just put it there as glue to keep food stuck to the plates for the food runners.  It doesn't serve any other purpose for dishes that are supposed to be crispy.  Bathrooms are single use which is ridiculous in a place this busy.  In 30 seconds in bathroom 3 people rattled the door handle.  I'm sure they couldn't even hear me shout, "Be right out!"    Bartenders pouring shots directly from the bottle into people's mouths in the middle of the tables?  Really?  At a restaurant at 9pm.  Reminds me of Ru San's which is also a tacky clubby nightmare.  But you don't find that out until you actually get here.  Not for me...

FucfpiOYvPJBlNnuF88Qew.text: I had high expectations seeing all the good reviews. We came in , had reservations but still waited 30 mins. I think they never check us in the first time , I had to ask someone else or else we would prob still had to stand to wait until someone asks. Our server was really nice even though she forgot a few things which she took off our bill at the end , but don't blame her because they were busy & we ordered a lot.  Heres my list of everything we had minus the drinks . (From 1-5 stars)  Bread;tasty w/ butter and/or olive oil/vin-4   Jamon & manchego balls; 5   Hanger steak; don't let the pics fool you, it's really small&  I'm not sure if was supposed to be cold- 2  Albondigas; like meat balls (tip: dip your bread in the sauce) -3   Oysters; room temperature-3  Shishito peppers; bland, no flavor not spicy- 1  Fried calamari -5  Scallop- 4   The Paella are good to share  - Vegetable paella; rice & veggies -3  - Seafood paella; they had a very unique taste to the seafood, like a authentic  grilled seafood smell/ taste (some prefer that , some don't ) -2.5   I would deff recommend if you're into wine & small bites! The atmosphere is nice , a little crowded.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

Qe1LYcgmr6TPeBzi8CLpqQ.text: I'm a huge fan of this place!   The overall atmosphere is romantic and chic. There's an intimate inside eating area as well as a fun patio and bar. I went for a friend's birthday dinner, and they sat the 5 of us at a table on the small outdoor patio. Fair warning, we had to wait about 45 minutes for a table on a Friday night, but it was well worth it! Per other reviews, the outside area is noisy and the music is pretty loud, but it didn't detract from the experience in my opinion.   The servers were super nice, and they were very helpful in explaining the Spanish tapas style! We ordered the patas bravas, the asparagus, and the fish. The food comes out on a rolling basis (in True tapas style), so feel free to order throughout the course of your meal.   Pro tip, they gave us a free dessert for my friend's birthday. If you do pick a dessert, I highly recommend the olive oil cake. It was absolutely delicious!

IUeKgKD9M7uEfP-JDCyfeQ.text: Yum! I would give this place five stars if it wasn't for the absolutely ridiculous wait AFTER knowing and agreeing to waiting two hours.   A girlfriend and I stopped in soon after this place opened. We knew there would be a wait and we were told two hours. So we belly up to the packed bar and grab a drink. The staff passed a few appetizers which was really appreciated since the food smelled fantastic. My friend checked on the wait after tow and half hours and was told it would be 15 minutes. At three hours she checked again with the same answer. Three and a half hours later... and hour and a half after we were initially told two hours we were sat. Had we been initially told three and a half we could have easily gone for a walk since the entire restaurant was jam packed and loud. Had we been told another hour after our first ask we also could have gotten another drink; we both waiting assuming we could just order at the table.   The food was fantastic! But the dishonestly at the front door could seriously be improved.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Comfy couch by the WC for waiting
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charcuterie board

gmuq7XdRe4KHv8fHD3oRHw.text: I forgot to take pictures of our dinner, but I attached the menu so you guys can check it out before going. I would highly recommend this place. From the drinks to dessert everything was AAAAMMMAAAZZZIINNNGGG. We had a charcuterie board that was fabulous. It had so much variety and hadn't had such good cheese and charcuterie in Charlotte that it took me back to Madrid.   My favorite small plate by far is the patatas bravas. They are so good I wanted to lick the plate lol. The spiced beef empanadas are fabulous too. If you want to add some veggies to your meal get the grilled asparagus, broccollini, and the shishito peppers. These were some of my favorite greens. Don't hesitate in ordering the pork belly it was SO GOODDD. The mussels are fantastic. Save  some one the bread that they bring at the beginning and dip it in the mussel sauce. It is fabulous.   Their drinks are really good and reasonable prices. The wine list is really nice and they have a good variety of different wines depending on your preference. I normally get a glass of the Grenache and it pairs really well with the food taste.   The interior decoration is gorgeous. I love how they decorated the place. It's a little loud since it's always packed, so you might need to speak a little louder.   The only reason I didn't give this restaurant a 5 star review is because it takes a while to get a table. We waited 2 hours for this meal, so hopefully they get this reduced.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Menu

OAT0UD2ggmoQ4bPhMRiHKg.text: Mood: Date night, romantic, outdoor dining, AND great patio with a pup. The yelp page says no dogs but they are allowed on the outside patio!  What to order: as odd as this is, I have to start with dessert because they were literally our favorite dishes. Olive oil cake is probably one of my favorite desserts I have had in recent memory. So moist, so good!!! Also we had the chocolate cake, very delicious too. On the other dishes - we liked the trout and the jamon. Shrimp were good but not spicy enough. Meatballs were good but not amazing. Tomato salad is not good enough to order again. Pulpo or octopus was great! Drinks were very good too but a little small. We got the two whiskey / bourbon drinks and a glass of wine each.   Other considerations: the service was slow and there were some spots where we had no idea what was happening. It was Friday night at 7 but just an FYI. We were there for 2+ hours.   Price point: somewhat expensive. We got a fair amount of food and the bill was around 140 with tip.  UPDATE: so the above still stands BUT my husband and I both woke up in the middle of the night, sick to our stomachs. Ek! We may only be going back for drinks and dessert :( feels like it could have been food poisoning!

b5ee5USntiZrj2atHCZ3mw.text: Review update: I had the food! It's soooo delicious. I love tapas style food, it's my favorite. It makes jt so easy to try many different options. And they serve everything with the most fabulous bread. Its addicting!!! I liked everything that I have tasted here.   The patio is a nice place to sit when the weather is nice. Overall a great restaurant. I really like hanging here.

Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

mfMqOU2w637Uh8vrpsIPGQ.text: One may assume Barcelona Wine Bar is yet another average Spanish tapas restaurant but that would be a terrible mistake!  My wife and I wandered in with our co-workers and friends early on a Friday, and was immediately greeted by the friendly staff and the rustic wooden interior. The restaurant was - surprisingly - already occupied by several patrons by 4:00pm.  We ordered the mussels, the truffle bikini, the crispy calamari, the gambas al ajillo, the dotted snapper crudo, the roasted baba ganoush, the albondigas, and the jamon & manchego croquettas. While nearly everything was excellent - I would pass on the calamari - there was one dish that stood out among the rest.   The truffle bikini was quiet the juxtaposition of familiar and new experiences. On one hand, it reminded me of a grilled cheese sandwhich my parents would fix for me. On the other, it included the robust flavor of ham, truffle and cheeses with which I am not familiar.  The prices are appropriate, the menu is diverse. I would recommend this as a great restaurant for groups or a casual date night.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Summer Street Sling
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mussles
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Gambas Al Ajillo

T8j58uI04E4Z-J81vH2xDw.text: I love all of the restaurants in the design center. I've been wanting to come here since it opened, so we decided to come at 4 right when it opened up to avoid the crowds and wait.   We were seated right away, but unfortunately no one came to help us for like 15 minutes. They were very apologetic about it though and brought us a complementary charcuterie board to make up for it!   Overall our service was great after that little mishap. They were all incredibly friendly and offered great recommendations.   We ordered a bunch of tapas and shared them. We tried the mussels, the truffle bikini, the crispy calamari, the gambas al ajillo, the dotted snapper crudo, the roasted baba ganoush, the albondigas, and the jamon & manchego croquettas.  Everything was really good. My favorites were probably the truffle bikini, shrimp (gambas), and the croquettas, but it was all delicious. The calamari was really the only thing that didn't stand out to me.   Their complementary bread was delicious and they will bring you as much as you want to use with the extra sauce from what you order.   I would definitely come back to try more! They also give you a free tapa token if you fill out their survey card at the end!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Beef tartare
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Charcuterie board
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

yhsy0OxjMUyHcn5el4UxyA.text: Always a great experience! I cannot rave about this place enough. We have been about 5 times now and it is the perfect place to have a girls night or date night.   From the moment you walk in to the moment you pay, the service is top notch. I love tapa style restaurants because you can order as you go and they understand that you just want to take your time, eating and drinking.   When ordering, here are some must haves: Albondigas  (meatballs -best thing on the menu), potatoes braves(they remind me of home fry style potatoes), Gambia's Al Ajillo (Shrimp Dish), Hanger Steak, Potato Tortilla, Red Snapper Crudo (ceviche), and the Spiced Beef Empanadas. I also suggest getting the Sangria Pitcher, it's great to share with friends or a date. One thing I love about their menu is that they change the menu every month with new specials from the chef so you can always get something new.   A couple of tips: if you are ordering for one, order 2 or 3 tapas. If you are ordering for 2, order about 4 to 5 tapas to share. All of the sauces that come on the tapas/plates are great when you dunk their beer into. The items lower on the menu take longer to prepare so they will come out slower than the items closer to the top of the menu. All plates come out at different times depending on when they are ready. They do take reservations so I highly suggest calling so you don't have to wait long.  Eat, Drink, & Relax!

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States

anD2qeXkx_IpIjuMfuJaYA.text: So here's the thing. I've eaten at Barcelona a few times and had many great small plates. Literally everything is good. So good that I forget to take pictures.   However, I love Barcelona for the service! The service is superb and the servers are always accommodating. On our most recent visit, we had to wait a bit longer than normal for an 8:30 pm reservation. We were meeting for a friend's celebration. To accommodate our inconvenience and enhance the celebration, they provided complimentary tapas and champagne.   If that wasn't enough, they also provided us with our favorite server, Elaine, who is a badass in her own right! It was absolutely superb.   A number of the guests in our party were first timers...now they will become repeat customers because Barcelona is everything you desire and more.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Guns &amp; Roses Sangria (careful with this one)
Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shishito Peppers

2loUFni1z2bP1Dd52LMOyQ.text: Spoiler alert: I wasn't that impressed.  Visited during the Art & Soul Southend street festival a little after 5 p.m. on a Saturday and was able to walk in and get a table. We were told that there was a long wait for the patio but, after spending most of the day outside, we were okay with an inside table.  The one and only shining part of the Barcelona experience was our waiter, Farmer. He was funny, took time to go over the menu and wine list, and was just a good time.  I came in craving a spicy margarita. I took the time to look over their menu and saw margaritas are not on their list but I asked because they have a bar and I figured why not? I was told they could do it and looked forward to my spicy marg. Unfortunately, it was not spicy at all. I took a whiff and it smelled spicy but there was not one ounce of heat from the jalapenos floating around in the drink. I guess that's what I get for ordering a margarita at a wine bar. As for the alcoholic options actually present on the menu, they do provide wine and champagne flights.  Okay, so the food. We ordered: The albondigas (meatballs) Calamari Patatas bravas Baba ghanoush  Out of the four, my favorite was the calamari with the albondigas a close second. The calamari was light and would pair very well with a crisp sauvignon blanc. Overall, personally, the food just wasn't up there for a tapas bar. I've had a lot better at other places.  This is definitely a place to people watch and be seen. Keep your expectations low when it comes to the food.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. &#34;Spicy&#34; margarita- note this drink is not on their cocktail menu

wxak05_iBDWtd0J_l3py4A.text: Had an excellent time at Barcelona. We sat at the bar and the the staff was excellent! Very friendly and knowledgeable about the food and wine, during a very busy time at the bar. Standouts on the food were the oysters, bacon wrapped dates, and croquets. There were plenty of good local selections. The trout and cauliflower were not our favorite, out of the eight dishes. Highly recommend Barcelona. Be back soon!

t5iAUyuRlD2dPnyNmfWYZg.text: My Husband and I are in town from Asheville and stumbled upon Barcelona's, it was slammed on a Thursday night with an hour and a half wait and the bar was 2 deep so we thanked them and walked out. One of the managers David followed us outside to let us know he could get us drinks and a spot on the patio to wait so we thought about it and headed back in. He grabbed Brian the bartender who got us awesome drinks immediately and then treated us as soon as we walked out to the table with some snacks on the house for choosing to come back in. What spectacular service!! Scott the bar manager stopped by to thank us and let us know it was their 8th day open. They are killing it!! As a restaurant manager myself the display of hospitality was outstanding and only enhanced the entire experience when we had some of the food alongside. Thank you for making our first night in Charlotte a great one guys!!

HPXNK-J68Nw2zI5NaXgBLA.text: Came here for a late dinner with some girlfriends. The white sangria was amazing and so were ALL of the tapas we ordered. The fresh bread was a wonderful bonus too! We will definitely be back.

yDFl95eqvNQgAQL9PnYgvA.text: My sister and some friends went to this place on Friday night. It was packed! We waited  two and a half hours for a table but enjoyed drinks from a server and the atmosphere while we waited. Very friendly staff who were all working to make a good impression on guests. When we got our table we ordered some tapas, octopus, hummus, and some other things I don't remember exactly what they were and for the main course we ordered paella. This place has the best paella I have ever had! It was so tasty and delicious. The food came out quickly and it was all warm and fresh. We loved the European feel of the restaurant and will definitely be back! My only complaint is that wine is expensive here, it was $12 for a 6oz Riesling which is pricey compared to other places. (Mickey & Mooch gives 8oz glasses of Riesling for $6 and it is a high end restaurant) Not a place to go for a drink alone but definitely worth the food!   The manager also stopped over a couple of times to check on us, seemed like a great guy who really cared about our experience!  We will be back!

Zc6a2qsi4jq60ExIa-z_BQ.text: Amazing atmosphere, service and food. The steak, brussel sprouts, octopus and croquettes were unreal!

-lqfMl-QzXG85kiEfcFBIQ.text: Without a doubt the BEST service I've ever received. The atmosphere is amazing, the outside area is super cute. The management team Rachel and Josh went above and beyond in making sure everything was enjoyable! It was my friends birthday and they made it the best time for him and my friends. Love love this place, the food is delicious, it tastes like everything is made with love. Recommend to anyone

jqufPJIe6ZX_JRDysIezsA.text: Tasty tapas and beautiful ambiance. I have been to Barcelona 2x now. Both times my server helped me customize my wine flight which was very helpful since the wine menu is large.   Would recommend the croquettes and snapper crudo!

xEV23Q-WFCiEFR9cSKkEjg.text: Such an amazing restaurant! If you have a celebration and you're an adventurous eater you won't want to miss out on this restaurant! Me and my family used to live in Europe and we visited Barcelona a few times. This is definitely a European dining experience. Slow paced, relaxing. The waiters don't pressure you to leave immediately like they do in most restaurants with a wait. Our waitress, Emma, was so nice and friendly to talk to! She also knew a lot about the menu and gave us some yummy recommendations which was great for our first time. The bread is to die for!!! Also don't skip on the charcuterie. Cannot wait to come in again and have some even more delicious food!!! Five stars for sure!

6BEB2szaRS8foqHt1dR3VQ.text: Lay over in Charlotte and the smells brought me in.  Fast and friendly service; along w a great cuisine.  A bit pricey; but that's to be expected at an airport

d9VLF5Z4icXK5_h20zXdxA.text: We tried this place for the first time last night   Food is 4-5 stars. Our group had a cheese board and 7 different items ranging from Brussels sprouts to pork belly and everything was really good.   HOWEVER,  the music was absurdly loud. Nightclub level. And as the night progressed you could hear the music volume get amped up a couple of times.   In a restaurant setting I don't understand who benefits from having the diners have to literally shout to be heard over the music from 3 feet away.

bv5Jl8-aeoPSMa00PzUqFw.text: I'll give it a solid 4. The food didn't really blow me away, it was just good. I think the most memorable dish we had were the croquetas. Although I will say the service was great. All the servers were very attentive without being overbearing. I'll definitely be back to explore the rest of the menu.

Dmy6bjxVGSuqHKpDMDM2OA.text: Came here on a Friday night and this place was packed. If you dont like packed placew this is not for you you. But if you are willing to tough it out and wait for good food and great mixed drinks you will love this place. The old rustic eclectic look of the place was nice. There was 8 of us and we ordered damn near the whole menu. Our favorites were the beef empanadas, brussel sprouts, patatas bravas, duck confit, and calamari. We did have some favas beans which were way to salty and do not recommend. Everyone loved every dish with the exception of the beans noted above. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be goimg back.

3Jikrchd32tuIkfZtgBjyQ.text: Amazing place the food was great the bartender was wonderful the atmosphere is excellent can't wait to go back next weekend

5wcuFs68BPab7VbgDG6LmQ.text: I had dinner at Barcelona Charlotte on 2/16 & 2/17, while both visits delivered tasty food and exceptional service.  I struggled a little bit at first with the menu items; however, a quick Google search will tell you what you need to know about the selection.  The restaurant is cozy, a little tight with table space, but nothing that I couldn't get over.  The ambiance was nice and the dinner experience was just very satisfying.  I would definitely visit this restaurant again.

5tXgLRS42PyS-9BARt6m1w.text: Top of my list for places to eat in Charlotte. Even if you aren't a big fan of wine, the food is delicious! I advise going on a weekday because the weekends are always packed but it just shows how good it is. The steak and potatoes are my fav dishes but everything I've had is mouth watering.

U3Ktaz4au2HHrYgxu2dnTg.text: Everything about this place was amazing. From the ambience, service, food and drink menu. We ordered a little bit of everything and I cannot say that there wasn't a dish that I wouldn't order again. Some of my favorites were the ham and cheese balls, charcuterie board, bacon wrapped dates, and ceviche. They had a great selection of Spanish wines. I've heard the olive oil cake is a must have but we were too stuffed to try.

C7AHz6Zw_KkYQyudGVerGw.text: I wish I could give 5 stars for my experience (I always had top-notch service and food in Atlanta).  However, after a great first course of tapas, our server went MIA.  We waited about 45 minutes after ordering our second course before our food came...and that was only after she checked on us once to realize our food wasn't there.    That said...Barcelona has amazing food and the atmosphere is really fun.  Awesome ambiance.  It's truly a must-try.

ONCfRzRaXRkyF_-FzvJf5A.text: Phenomenal tapas, great drinks and fun ambience. As is a new place in town, the wait was long but it was worth every minute of it. Bread with a wonderful olive oil to start, get some sangria while you review the menu. Pictured are my fav dishes from last night. The paella was also good, but I think it was over cooked. Very tasty. Gave them 5 starts because overall everything was great and some dishes were just wonderful. Can't wait to go back.

zEl8dzUaTw51pYzMrsSTvA.text: My girlfriend and I dined here for our anniversary and had a lovely evening. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful when recommending drinks, appetizers, and tapas. We couldn't stop ordering! Everything was so good and the vibes were great. Loved the food and the atmosphere. Great bathrooms too!

0MlWCKhICKtVD5EvJKojbQ.text: So at first when we walked in took 5 minutes for someone to talk to us, but once we were seated everything was phenomenal. Our serves Kasey and Emma were so nice, and took great care of us. It was our first time, and I can't wait to go back again! Definitely recommend it. Parking was very easy as well!

E-5IVRDvwaoEGVoNuoUOJA.text: Where do I even begin? We came to celebrate a friend's birthday on a Wednesday night- we didn't expect it to be as busy as it was! This place is popular.  Although they've just opened, they've got their "ish" together. We waited for over an hour (a little bit over our projected wait time) and the staff was extremely apologetic and they truly took care of us once we got sat!  Super affordable, and friendly staff! Shoutout to Patrick!! Potentially front of house manager? He approached us when we first walked in and we were clearly waiting to get a drink. He made a point of asking us if we needed any recommendations and went around the bar himself to get our samples. He continued to serve us while the restaurant was extremely busy!   Ah-mazing. And this is coming from someone with 10+ years in the service industry!

yMAJm6yvlQEID3kxZReK_w.text: Trendy, staff was nice and good wine. Very noisy. We like tapas, but plates were still small, a bit too much mayonnaise with many of the dishes. Atmosphere was fun, but we found the tapas at Bucca in SouthPark better.

ghqt2ZBz89-63Xic0hknRQ.text: Wish I could give this experience 6 stars! Our server Dawn was excellent, and the food was on point. We shared the asparagus a la plancha, croquettes, patatas bravas and truffle bikini and they were all perfect. Wine list is extensive and our server was knowledgeable on the wine which is always great. Sit outside, the space is beautiful!

FNk395rQIhp5fWRsJ2BHmg.text: I ate here for the first time this week and I am OBSESSED. Our waitress Elaine went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. She was seriously too kind. I thought the Sangria was great and every tapas we tried was delicious and very well priced. The place was packed - even on a Wednesday at 6pm! And for good reason. Big fan - I will be back! It's worth the hype.

Uaibt8jNrkg-XpSdMmor6Q.text: This is probably my favorite tapas place in town. The food is amazing and the service excellent. The first time we just hang at the bar and tried a couple of tapas. They had a 3 hour wait. I recommend making reservations. The second visit we experienced the tapas and love it! Definitely will be back with friends that visit from out of town.

0Vxy5Btf4OEKu40pc7nP3g.text: Place is awesome for a date night. Great decor and drinks. Food is very mediocre. I love seafood paella but we left most of it, very salty. I've been to Spain and love tapas but wasn't a fan of the food here.

YtbO_QgMrqPGpvIDSaeYUA.text: These guys are killing it. My wife and I popped in on a Thursday night visit to Charlotte, and they were slammed busy. My wife and I both manage restaurants in Asheville, so we were understanding of the 1.5 hour wait time for a table, but just thought maybe we'd come back another time. Noticing us leave, David ran outside to stop us. He let us know there was an outdoor patio with a little more seating space, and it was all self service so we could casually have a drink out there. He was so nice to do that for just a random couple in a sea of paying customers, we were impressed.   But it didn't stop there. Not only did David get us back in the door, but with just a look, he got one of his bartenders, Brian, to come out from around the bar of customers 2-deep, and take our drink order personally with a hand shake and an introduction. Brian then proceeded to make our drinks and get our tab started and closed in record time. I had the Whiskey Root cocktail and my wife had a glass of Sauvignon Blanc, both delicious. We went from impressed to wowed.   But it still wasn't over. We made our way to the outdoor patio with our drinks, and David was already out there clearing off a table for us. After sitting down he brought us a complimentary snack of bread, olive oil (sooooo good), whole olives, spiced nuts, and eggplant. This had really done it. At this point it had seriously been less than 10 minutes since we had decided to pass and move on to another place, and now we were sitting at a table, with drinks and food, feeling like royalty.   Let me be clear, the drinks, food, and atmosphere were all top notch... but the service was out of this world! Like I said, my wife and I are both restaurant managers in Asheville, and we were really blown away. Barcelona Wine Bar was an incredible piece of our night and our visit to Charlotte. We will definitely be back, and all of our friends will be hearing about this place from us for sure!

HCe66YoQEsoglX3nGSBs8A.text: Bartender FRIDAY is amazing!!! We have been here several times we refuse to sit at a table so he can take care of us at the bar. He is very knowledgeable about the menu and makes amazing drinks !!! We love it here because of him. He makes the place.

VTYjl-5Rd4gEWQkTRD84wQ.text: I've tried multiple times to check out this place and finally was able to get a table with a decent wait time. The best time to go is between 4-6, anything later you will wait for a hour or more. The service was amazing, we told our server what we liked and were given great recommendations. We both had wine, pulpo, mussels, and patatas bravas. Food was amazing and flavorful, definitely coming back soon.

YID4DmK3VW90O96pyS98Nw.text: Great place to go with a group to share small plates. Pretty busy so be prepared for a wait. There were 7 of us and we were squished into 2 small tables which made it hard to cram all of our small plates in. Food and drinks were great with the exception of 1 - the fabada which was overly salty. Would come here again though.

lwJGF8LSBoLYQiikB9T-pg.text: The restaurant was located in SouthEnd right behind Jenis Icecream. A lot of street parking and there is also a parking lot across the street that you can utilize . I arrive promptly at 6:55 to check in for our 7pm reservation . The hostess mentioned that when the majority of my party arrived we would be seated . I would say everyone was there no later then 7:15 ..we didn't get seated till 7:34, granted the health inspector dropped a surprise visit to the restaurant and was using our table to hook his laptop up and do what he needed to do . (Understood ....I assume that's why we received on the house a basket of calamari for the wait..much appreciated). The food was good , everything I had from beef empanadas (my fav...also the oysters were  ) to blowfish with salsa verde was quite tasty and cooked right . I will be honest and say the food is not filling though. I would say don't go there expecting to leave stuff unless you purchase their paella. My drink Lucy B was decent, I didn't finish it but it wasn't terrible . Maybe my palette with the food I was eating and drink just didn't mix right to me. The ambience of the place is beautiful , from the structure to the decor ...very rustic and new age

X04np4uUHhWwTSDaj1mDMw.text: Went for the first time last night and everything about our experience was amazing. The atmosphere, the service, the food, the sangria. They have a great outdoor area, too. We will definitely be back!

SAbfx0uLMRWkF_fUWCFG0Q.text: This place is incredible. They have great service and even better food. I ordered 5 different tapas and loved them all. Well worth the wait especially for the south end area.

TTcXhtpcjl1HKUEmWD5PHw.text: We had a birthday party planned for two months for a party of 14. They guaranteed us they would accommodate however this is False. How many are we got there we wait an hour and a half and finally they said that they cannot accommodate us. The manager was extremely rude and the hostess staff were completely clueless I would never recommend a party greater than four actually attend this establishment.

vRmJHxem_DbZJzQn95iHHA.text: My girlfriends and I had a great experience on Thursday night at Barcelona wine bar. We had a group of 7 girls and our waitress- Dawn- recommenced the $35 option for groups of our size. They brought out TONS of different tapas of their choice and we all loved them. We were stuffed and Dawn was awesome! It was so fun to try so many different options and it made it so easy for a group of our size. Very happy Dawn mentioned this option from the beginning! Will be going back asap!   Thanks for such a great night and good food!

tWhrSacoYI_82ogJHwHzGg.text: bit underwhelming given the hype. Very cool vibe and service was fast (we walked in without reservations at 5 on a Saturday, but it seemed to fill up quickly after that ... service deteriorated a bit as they got busy).  I would say the food was adequate. The hanger steak was a bit off (it's hard to describe, but I felt it should be less work to chew); I'm also not a fan of the truffle vinaigrette that accompanied it. It sounds like these should go together, but after trying it, I would have preferred something else. In general, the pairings didn't seem to compliment each other. The potato tortilla was a bit bland, but had some nuanced flavors. I would have liked a sauce that brought out these flavors. Instead the chive sour cream brought out the blandness (the taste of sour cream overwhelmed any other flavor). We also tried the Spinach-Chickpea Cazuela and the Trumpet a la Plancha (at the suggestion of the waitress). The chickpea dish was bland in my opinion and the Trumpet (i.e. mushroom) dish was underwhelming and smaller than I would have expected (it was by far the smallest of the dishes we ordered). Also, I totally understand the tapas style menu - but felt that there just wasn't enough on the plate to constitute a meal.   The Guns & Roses sangria was great. The menu rotates and there are many other dished to try, so we will certainly give it another shot (plus I'd love another glass of the sangria).

s0QGmUcOqrKWuU48VZrqlQ.text: Very nice spot, came here for a day date with my love and it's a very intimate atmosphere. You get a lot of food portioned for the cost and the food is delicious! We had the spinach chickpea cazuela, the cauliflower, veggie paella, and my love had the parrillada (this was A LOT of meat- I don't eat meat at all so he definitely took lots of leftovers). For the two of us, we spent about $60, will definitely return!

TYZs-oHpZ4nyOsfraQxJvQ.text: Food was great. Ambiance was amazing. Service was spectacular. Will definitely be back! The red snapper melts in your mouth. Give it a try.

photos.caption: Photo of Barcelona Wine Bar Charlotte - Charlotte, NC, United States. Red snapper. Melts in your mouth.

mIMiK6OkajmEGAvbzcKsng.text: BEYOND disappointed in the service. Came here for my boyfriends birthday with a large party. They wouldn't seat us until everyone was there (understandable) once our party was there we waited AN HOUR to get an answer of when we will be seated. I get your busy but we made reservations a month prior. Not that it's acceptable for the staff to be rude but for the manager, omg this is why I will never go back. The manager was a flat out asshole- he had attitude, was rude and didn't care to make the situation better. He actually told us we could leave if we wanted  SMH

jEryYS0a_gK-0XPP4xYX2g.text: Food is amazing! Drinks were amazing! Our service was not good, but it may be because we sat outside. Our waitress was really bad, and we also had 4 tapas we didn't receive but we're on our bill. Otherwise will be back for sure!

v2upxbxWLAKLZaoF3l7wwA.text: First time here.... Nice place and decor but I kinda thought the food was mediocre and not worth the cost. I often dine at tapas style restaurants so I can taste a little of everything but not really impressed here. Only three protein choices and the cane out cold which was kind of annoying. The hostesses and servers were great though, very polite and quick.

zgFCk2gBvFIbscQR_diXFA.text: Great wine selection. Awesome small plates. And okay service. Kind and polite wait staff, but very busy and they made a few mistakes. Would definitely go back though!

OMGB_0RKN95eKfzoPE3AqA.text: One of the best tapas restaurants I've been to - in the US or elsewhere. In fairness, I've never had tapas in Spain, so that might be an issue for some.   The Brussels sprouts were incredible. Perfectly crispy and tasty. The artichokes were tender and perfectly seasoned.  The mussels were also really tender (even though I don't like mussels, usually). And the hangar steak?  It was as though God himself cut those pieces of meat, seasoned them, and placed them upon my tongue.   Have I mentioned the paella?  Probably not, because it was so good I was put into some kind of trance.    Our server was amazing. It was an incredible experience. Thank you!!!

0CqGM858UIkXfqdr0BU84w.text: This place is amazing! They have tons of gluten free options and every time we have been, the service has been excellent. We had a huge group in there last night and they were very attentive and kept track of everyone's orders extremely well!

3ADYHpxuzMZVsIrLQDff0Q.text: Amazing food! All our selections were awesome, definitely better with a group so you can all take a bite of each tapas. The wine menu was also reasonable - varieties of wines and prices. The service was by far excellent. The waitress Elaine was friendly, helpful and efficient. You definitely need a reservation, wait times for people without was about 2-3 hours on Saturday peak. They take reservations on their website. Super easy to do! So happy and can't wait to go back!!
